excellent stay at the Trident Mumbai, will definitely recommend
i really enjoyed my stay at the Trident Hotel, Mumbai, its the only Hotel I would stay in Mumbai, very clean and neat, value for money

Firstly we did not stay in the Trident. On arrival we were informed the hotel was full and so we'd been moved next door to the Oberoi. Which really was an upgrade. Oh my word. It was fabulous. We were treated like royalty and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. One of the best and most luxury hotel experiences I have ever had. It's not cheap, but definitely memorable and very very comfortable. We had booked without breakfast at the Trident and got breakfast included at the Oberoi. So all in all it was very much a good deal for us. We loved it.
The management was excellent.Our flight was in the evening,they generously allowed for a late afternoon check out.The service and friendliness of staff made our stay memorable.
internet was very expensive - five star hotels should include free wifi

the problem that u must pay for the internet , the location and room condition are excellent , its very clean inside rooms, very large lobby and fast check out , i faced a problem that room was not ready inspite i arrived at 3 afternoon
the staff at check in was not helpful or co operate , but others were great , the rooms very clean and houskeeping very excellent , location great
Fantastic. The staff was wonderful, the food (breakfast + dinner) was great, the pool was amazing and the room spotless. We will stay again!

This is a well located hotel in the Colaba area of Mumbai. Morning walks along the sea front are easy and relatively quite (for Mumbai). It is in the tourist part of Mumbai so close to Gateway of India and the shopping areas. After a day out in the chaos of Mumbai, it is a real pleasure to return to the peacefulness of this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed. The restaurants serve great food. The staff are friendly and attentive. All round a great stay.

- very comfortable beds
- very good TV and amenities
- service is excellent - service with a smile and go out of their way to help you - including booking dinners, etc. it seems like they are genuinely proud to work for Trident and are actually look
We stayed a night. Bed is very comfy. Bathroom finished in stone. View towards queens necklace and the setting sun over the arabic sea is magnificent.

being in nariman point, south bombay is as classy as it gets in india. but u can forget about travelling to other parts of bombay without passing through hell traffic. FYI the coast line is just full of wavebreakers but it's a good place for a jog or, in the local slang, "timepass".

as for the breakfast... get in line. even when you get a place u are forced to share and have a kooky face time with strangers.

buffet dinner is good and recommended
prompt check-in and check-out, courteous and helpful staff
This time i was with my family and kids. All of us enjoyed the stay and hospitality by hotel. It was great.

i really enjoyed my stay here for 2 nights. service is excellent. rooms are all one can expect and have al the amenities. the facilities are great, especially the gym, which for a hotel is about as good as it gets. i wish there was a beach. the ocean is fronted with more of a barrier and rocks. no sand. and having to pay us $/day for internet is frustrating anywhere, but certainly not necessary or expected in india. most travel surveys say the #1 gripe of travelers is having to pay for internet. trident, are you listening? food is good but also overpriced. but all that said, i'd definitely return.

i stayed in 3 different 5 star hotels in india on my current stay sun and sand,novotel and trident, being the biggest of the 3 the service was super quick, rooms clean and athmosphere 5 star. will return in future again.

3-kms-long beautiful promenade that rings a natural bay with Ocean viewing . 15 minutes Walking distance to Gate of India which the entry point Elephant Island. 
Excellent service .
This was a really pleasant surprice. Everything is top quality from the breakfast to the pool. Clean and nice rooms with top service. We will definitely stay here again the next time in Mumbai.
good location with quiet environment in busy life of mumbai ,restaraunt is average , room services are excellent.

We had an amazing experience staying at Trident Nariman Point. Our room was on the 30th floor and even though ours was a city view room, from that up the sea right outside our room. Its a perfect place for a romantic getaway. The location is amazing, u step outside the hotel and there's the marine drive and u can see the famous 'Queen's Necklace'. You can take a stroll in the morning or at night by the sea . The hotel staff is readily available and can cater to any needs that u may have. The morning breakfast spread quite lavish, specially the bakery goods. There are plenty of places to hang out in the area as well. I highly recommend this hotel. Absolute value for money.
Nice hotel facing sea,comfortable,all large bussiness offices are around, easy acces to the city ,with good nearby restaurants,staff very freindly,

I arrived early so they gave me a complimentary breakfast while I waited for a room.  Every time I went to the pool they gave me a bottle of water, water spray bottle fro spritzing and a complimentary bottle of sunscreen

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was big and clean and also the seaview was inviting for relaxation. The breakfast buffet was gorgeous with lots of "custom-made" food available. The staff was very attentive and beyond friendly and helped me out with many useful tips on where to go and what to see in the evening.
The next time I'm in Mumbai, I will definitely stay at this hotel.

we were upgraded to a very nice suite on arrival which was a nice surprise. the hotel and room were clean and comfortable.all staff were very well organised and polite.
i would recommend this hotel.

I was surprised that wifi was not free!!!
However I had to talk to the Manager in charge to ask for complementary wifi, which they gave me right away.
So, I guess this is a pro and con.
If u don't ask for a free wifi, u will be charged!

really efficient and friendly staff.
beautiful clean and comortable room.
brilliant shower with toiletries and bathrobes.
within walking distance of gate of india and colaba causeway.
A five star hotel without the five star prices. Great service from all the staff!

extensive selection of breakfast

rooms are small but very clean

service is excellent

great location as its only 5-10mins away from colaba which has a few main attractions and markets.

Great location Fantastic staff. Really did have service with a smile. 
The staff will organize just about anything for you, great stuff
Very good location for tourist destinations
Breakfast buffet was very good

I feel proud to be resident in the  Trident Hotel for three nights
The service are of high standard.
The food specially breakfast was very nice.

Although the Staff were very friendly and always smiling and ready to help with any querias. I found the modern  bathroom very difficult to function. The taps were difficult to use and not user friendly. The privacy was a point of contention although they had blinds to close the bathroom.

Otherwise a very enjoyable stay.

The Hotel is an Ideal location for business traveller and lots of places to visit nearby.
Good service from the staff and efficient in handling the request.
Good restaurants in the hotel especially the Breakfast spread good.
Travel time to airport on a working day is about 2-2.5hrs and we almost were late for our flight.
Awesome location looking over the Marine Drive very cordial staff good restaurants n luxuriousness in its every aspect.

the hotel is located along the scenic marine drive facing the sea. ideal location for visit to the commercial centres and tourist areas in the old city. service at the hotel is great and you will find very helpful staff. the lobby does get crowded during the mornings. restaurants are good  and can enjoy a hearty breakfast.

This is the best hotel for those who like modern hotels. The location is perfect on the beachfront. It is a lovely walk from the hotel to Chowpati Beach. The service is of high standard and all guests are treated like VIP's. The restaurants are excellent too. The swimming pool is the best, with a magic view of the whole bay.

I had a great stay and the staff did their best to sort out an issue I had with Agoda!
I had mistyped the booking date and the staff make huge efforts to help me with it!

One of the more popular business hotels in Mumbai for a reason. The room rate was good value for money, check in was quick and efficient. Location is right on the sea but also in the prime business district. On site restaurants are expensive but top-notch. There is also a good shopping arcade within the hotel. Rooms are modern, very clean, and tastefully furnished. Wish the WiFi was free.
Everything was great all staff members hotel room service food all great up to the mark

very nice hotel joining the oberon.
it is a good spot to start seeing mumbai from.
the food and facilities are good. they have an excellent gym.
very easy to get a taxi and see the southern part of the city.
maybe a bit pricey for a 4-5 star.

We had a great stay. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Our on-line check-in for our flights was very ably done for us by the staff. My daughter's reporting time for her flight was several hours before mine. I wanted to see her off at the airport.The conceige made arrangements with the ITC Maratha Hotel, which is close to the airport, so that I could spend time in the comfort of a Hotel after seeing off my daughter before I could check in for my flight later on that night. Moreover, my daughter and I were allowed to occupy our room much beyond the checkout time as we were not due to depart for the airport until late that afternoon.

During my short stay there, me and my friends got ripped-off by a cabby who had covered the already run-up meter with a piece of cloth at the beginning of our journey unbeknownst to us. When we reached the destination he sprang a surprise ripping us off over 5-times the normal fare.

The next time for my airport trip also another cabby tried this ruse but got earful of me. The concierge was totally unhelpful.
 
The hotel management can't be unaware of this rip-off. Guests expect a honest cab service inside the hotel. Trident management should curb this blatant exploitation as it spoils the otherwise wonderful experience of the hotel guests.

This is the 2nd time I've been to the hotel. And as usual, they were top notch. The room, the location and the service, I wouldn't grudge. But the food is just fine but not something you would go gaga over. Not to mention its very expensive. The complimentary breakfast on the other hand is a delight... they have something for everyone, though their south Indian dishes could do with an overhaul.

That apart, I had a nice stay. Will visit again, though this hotel is more designed for business travelers.

I have been to the hotel many times during my previous visits to Mumbai but it was our first stay there. We were delighted when we arrived at the Hotel as the vibe was great. It was lively and if you like "people watching " this is definately the place. 
The room was alright except that the aircon wasnt working too well. After much complaining it was only on our final night that they offered a change of room, by which time, it didnt really make sense. 
We visited 3 of their dining establishments where service fell really short. It was rather shocking that they were so short staffed especially in a place like India. The coffee place at the lobby really fell short, they couldnt even deliver a decent cup of tea and the tea had to be sent back as it was cold when served. The whole experience of having tea and coffee took about 1.5 hours not because we were chilling but simple because we were not served. We had a better experience at India Jones. Service fell short again at Frangapani ( where breakfasy was served ). Again they were short staffed and simply couldnt deal with the crowd which is surprising as they are a big hotel and should expect large numbers. 
I would return simply because of the location and vibe but would definately not patronise the dining establishments.

We stayed for 5 days. Right from the get go the staff made our stay special. We got complimentary club room access. 
The room and view were excellent. The room itself was extremely clean and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable as well. 

We had a very good experience overall. When I went to settle the bill there was a confusing charge for soda, since we'd been sure not to touch the mini bar. Not only was this removed, all charges for water were taken off as well!

We had some friends over and a glass was broken in the shenanigans. It was cleaned up within 5 minutes after the call to housekeeping. 

Housekeeping was very prompt. We went out a lot, and every time we came back our room had been cleaned. 

Just a great experience overall. We had a very pleasant stay. Thank you for the memories!
It was a memorable stay. Good Hospitality extended by the hotel staff. The only not so good experience was the waiting time for breakfast. Space is less and people were more

We arrived very late after 5hr flight delay. Upon arrival, the staffs were very helpful and proactive. We were surprised that we received a free upgrade to the upper level hotel Oberoi, which is next door and internally connected.
We had meals in both Trident and Oberoi hotels, the food were great! The staffs in both hotel are fantastic. The location is right near the beach line with a long beach walk, which is good for morning and evening exercise.

We stayed at Trident for 3 nights in December 2012 as we wanted to see the nearby attractions and also to avoid the crowded parts of Mumbai . Trident Nariman point is situated in a not so busy business district compared to other Mumbai areas. The bedrooms are spacious , clean and comfortable.
The hotel staff were very good especially the restaurant staff. One staff I would commend is Negraj in Frangipani restaurant; he was excellent as he served us very well during the breakfast. 
The housekeeping were also good especially the housekeeping supervisor Maria Cruz who provided us with the information in visiting shopping places in Mumbai and also helped my wife with her laundry. Thank you Maria.
The concierges are very busy due to a high volume of guests arriving and leaving and therefore did not provide us with the service we had expected. Also the concierge arranges taxis to the airport and fixes the price with taxi drivers.
Buffet style breakfast was included with the room and it was very good. They had all types of options available.
The staffs are friendly and helpful. Feel safe and very relax. Wifi is not free but it's not that expensive. The buffet at Frangipanni is also nice. Highly recommended.
From our arrival at the Trident our stay was apleasure.  Staff were friendly, room was excellent (Bed softest we had found in india). Location great, breakfast was good.  Could not fault this hotel.
it was very short , nothing from  the facilities used , i liked the room but the problem is you have to pat alot to use the internet
Nothing as such since had been staying regularly on my business trips to Mumbai
Had a great time and everything we asked for was granted
Felt very welcomed back, treated very nicely to an upgraded room. Truly impeccable service!!!
Very comfortable stay . Amazing service , amazing view , amazing location ...simple amazing at the price

I had a very comfortable stay here. I was pleasantly surprised when I got a room upgrade to a sea facing room. the view of Mumbai sea is beautiful from here. The room was also newly renovated & my kids loved it. The service is excellent, with hogh standards of customer satisfaction. Also it is located in South Mumbai which is a great area to be in.

We were most impressed with everything about this hotel:The friendly professional service,the comfortable well appointed room with lovely bathroom and stunning view,the wonderful swimming pool and especially the great restaurant.The breakfast selection was varied and beautifully prepared and presented and our dinner was superb.The staff could not be faulted.A really fantastic stay.
Great stay. Food is overpriced considering the quality, but overall very good hotel.

very high standards indeed all around, couple of things to note:
the internet/wifi is not free as was advertised on this site.
there's no place to smoke and drink.. it would be nice to have had a terrace bar considering the location.
The best hotel I have stayed in Mumbai. The employees are incredible! The room and amenities were wonderful.
It's one of the good hotel at mumbai we ever visited.

Excellent stay. Purified water was a big plus - only time out of around 6 trips to India where I haven't got ill. Hotel location great for exploring South Mumbai (and walking to the Wankhede Stadium). Staff all very helpful and friendly. We did suffer inconvenience about needing to change rooms after 1 night due to some booking error, but resolved very well - all 3 of my party were upgraded to suites. I would definietly recommend the hotel to others.
The rooms are spacious,clean and all staff helped to all our needs. Food at the restaurant were very good, above my expectation, however bar prices are high. Beautiful hotel with a great location.

I had business trip to India and stayed here. It was luxurious and the room was totally clean. The location was also pretty convenient for the business traveller as it was located at the center of the business district. I highly recommend it.

lovely hotel connected via a shopping centre to the Oberoi.

Was in Mumbai to watch the cricket so it was an nice 10 minute stroll down to the ground.

Extremely dissappointed in the hotel policy to charge for internet access (this is however the case for all the top end hotels in Mumbai).  I believe that a 5 star hotel should be offering it as a core part of their service and not treating it as a money making opportunity.

The service of the hotel is very good and the staff are very polite. The room is spacious and clean. We enjoyed watching the sunset at the poolside and also at the lobby where there is a guy that plays the piano very evening.

an excellent hotel in a great location and not very expensive for mumbai 5 star standards
excellent service good rooms
good selection of resturants, an excellent beakfast and swimming pool
would recommend this hotel for business, nightlife,vaccation and all purpose
a truly great hotel

Wonderful terrace facing the water with in the pool area - they should have a bar though serving drinks outside.  In the same area as Taj Mahal hotel and half the price.  If you have business in this area of Mumbai, couldn't be a better choice of hotel

Clean and good hotel, nice to stay.
A lot to see around.

We had a fantastic time staying here.  The rooms are great.  The gym and pool are both very, very nice.  The buffet breakfast in the morning had excellent selection and taste.  But most importantly, the concierge and service staff were the most helpful and friendly of any hotel I have stayed at.
My Stay at hotel was very nice.I enjoyed beautiful surroundings and fentastic restaurents at the Hotel.

exelent hotel with very good rooms on the see side
and very good breakfast
very peaceful.staff were very friendly and helpful.the location is excellent.will defenitly go back.

Awesome rooms with awsome view, breakfast buffe has limited spread but what ever options are available are delicious.
Staff is very courteous, extra ordinary service.

I was freely upgraded to a sea-view room, which I must say, was worth the money. Check in was quick and hassle free... I was OK with a smoking room initially as I do smoke occasionally, but unfortunately it was too "smoky" and claustrophobic for me. I asked for a change to a non-smoking room and the staff were extremely polite and nice enough to immediately find me a non smoking room, and that was the right decision! Beautiful room and a grand view from the 32nd floor greeted me... 

That apart, their breakfast is definetely better than other 5star hotels and me and my wife never missed that! The food service through in room dining was quick, and the food was better than expected. So kudos to them on the kitchen. Bit pricey, but guess not so much different price wise from other 5stars again. The opium den(their pub) was again a nice affair. 

We stayed 4 nights as a couple and we found the hotel neat, very clean, with nice food and great service.  Ofc apart from the fabulous views. Would visit again and I highly recommend others too..

P.S: It looks and feels like a business hotel, which it is. It can be more romantic, given the location.
A lovely and memorable stay . The sea view room are good, staff is polite and helpfull
on the beach marine drive nice to walk in early morning
it was nice short stay , they upgrade my room to sea view and really was attractive view . excellent for business espicially who has business south mumbay , very far from airport
It is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in around the world
Spent two lovely nights on business. Hotel was very accommodating and found for me the cardboard box I needed to ship some materials to my onward destination.

I had a very good stay at Trident.  Everything was what I had immagined before I arrived.  The only thing I noticed was food was very expencive.    for a buffet dinner was too high.
Overall it was a fantastic stay and will stay there again.
Clean rooms; Hospitality was excellent! Good comfort
I will return to this location if in this city again and will highly recommend to my friends and family to stay at the Trident.

i wish the room had been better dusted
and exterminated of bugs
but other than that very pleasant stay
friendly service

The location of this hotel is perfect on Marine Drive overlooking the sea. Excellent staff always smiling and helpful. It was my partners birthday and we got a special cake delivered to the room as a surprise from the hotel. Very thoughtful of the trident. Rooms are modern, comfortable, cozy and well designed. overall a complete delight.
Friendly service
Friendly service

a fantastic hotel in the heart of mumbai - right on marine drive.  what was more impressive than the actual hotel was the staff - all very polite, considerate and willing to help.  rooms have recently been refinished, very comfortable.
it was very comfortable and very luxrious stay in the hotel

We could have exellent stay.
The concierge helped us so much and atended friendly, and arranged perfect tours.
The room was clean and not so small, and most of all, I enjoyed very much the breathtaking view of Arabian Sea.
And the location is good, too. Near Colaba Causeway and Marine Drive. 
Thank you so much!! I could have very comfortable stay in Mumbai.
The hotel is nicely located with good service. However, the food was hopeless even at Frangpani, which is known for its fine italian cuisine.
Hotel is located besides Marine Drive and near many popular local attractions. The swimming pool has a great view. Hotel room is clean with adequate space.
it's the price worth and with an agoda-booking affordable. the location is the biggest bonus.
The staff was very polite and willing to fullfill your wishes at any time. The rooms are very clean an hygi√´nic. Room, cleaning and laundry service well organised.

One review per stay at the hotel

Agoda allows only one review per customer for each stay at the hotel. Note: if you'd like to update a review, please contact us; we'll remove your previous review and let you know how/when you can submit a new one.
i stayed there for 3 days and loved my stya there to the core,from the beautifully managed room to the sea facing view to the ever smiling staff...loved every bit of it

right from the moment we stepped into the hotel we were greeted by one friendly staff member after another. we had made a request to get a corner room on a top floor and had no problem getting it. the hotel is incredibly plush and very comfortable to stay in. i have stayed in hotels in san francisco, london, dubai and singapore, but have never received the kind of personalized service this hotel offered me. the staff at this hotel is more than one notch above what i was used to.

a small word of caution. we booked a room package with breakfast here on agoda but when we checked in we were told that breakfast was not included in the charge. it was not a big deal and after showing them that breakfast was in fact included in the package rate, they quickly agreed to it. it might be useful to give them a call before checking in and confirming your package.

i am definitely going to be staying at this hotel again. i have a trip planned in january again to mumbai, and would not dream of staying anywhere else.
breakfast spread was good. First class service. Highly recommend n would love to stay there again on my next trip.
very nice room good side seeing very clean rooms I haved stayed four times, very near from the shopping areas
great people and great staff. luxury hotel. the room service is very slow and the food could have been better. great location and awesome view from the higher floors
it was comfortable stay. we enjoyed  the most because of the amazing view from the higher floors. it helps to get a better view of the sun rise and sun set. wish t go bac soon

I use this for a transit stop.  The rooms are smart and designed for the needs of a business traveler.  The hotel is located in south Bombay which is one of the few pleasant parts of the city.  Service is outstanding with a responsive staff.

This hotel is truly and oasis amongst the chaos of a wonderful Mumbai.
This hotel exceeded all our expectations. The rooms were so clean and nice. The staff were incredibly polite. The food was amazing. We also received an upgrade which was a lovely treat.
Nothing was to much. A truly outstanding hotel.

This hotel covered everything from staff coutesy to hygiene to location it was just outstanding. The food was sensational.
I would rate it as one of the best hotels we've stayed in

The rooms are a bit small, but well maintained. The entrance and the lobby itself are very well made and with good security. The hotel is ON Marine Drive, so the view from the room was spectacular, especially in the evening. Also you could just walk along the promenade as and when you please. Good connectivity to the downtown financial hub.
Old but renwed classy hotel, with very high security at the entrence

The room was nice and seemed like recently done up. The staff at the concierge and reception were very coordial and well trained. Such courteousy you will normally find in Oberoi - Trident chain in India and i was happy to see that without deviation. 
Over all property is very well maintained. The location how ever is excellent with morning and evening sea breeze that can be experienced from the swimming pool deck. 
Over all a nice experience
Comfortable room, great food and incredibly courteous and helpful staff.
had a great time-the sea view made it out of the world (but in the heart of bombay!!)

I would highly recommend the hotel both for business or leisure. The location was central and overlooking the sea, the hotel was beautiful and the staff excellent. It was a very comfortable stay overall and I would rate the hotel as excellent.

having been traveling india for 10 weeks, coming to the trident was like a breath of fresh air. the entire ambiance of the hotel is calm, quite, and serene--some things missing in every-day india life. the staff is absolutely amazing; some of the kindest people i've met in india. the location is great--close to main tourist attractions, as well as good dining and shopping. rooms were impeccably clean, and tidied throughout the day. would definitely recommend!!!
i had a wonderful time. had come to bombay for a meeting.. out of my hectic schedule still had a relaxing experience. Friendly staff and overall a great experience
It was great sharing the same hotel with Mumbai Indian team. Hospitality was great and we were offered upgrade on arrival.

stay was very good frindly staff good service. shoping was good clean room maintenance of the room was okay because there was no ligth in my room no electric so the maintenance staff toke long time to fix the fault in room # 3106.
No profanity, threats, prejudiced comments, hate speech or other non-family-friendly content. No reports of deaths, violent criminal activity or participation in drug-related activity
The hotel is in a great location with great sea view; nice comfortable bed and friendly staff, great swimming pool

The Hotel is located overlooking the Bay. Great location and convenient to shopping and sightseing. I stayed in a club room overlookijg the bay which was well equipped and spacious.

staff are very diligent and willing to help.

the staff from the doorman, to the concierge, the reception, room service, housekeeping and the telephone operators were all extremely nice and friendly. service was prompt.

the in room dining was out of this world.

only problem was there was a charge for internet use.think this should come free in today's world

great experience overall

We would highly recommend the hotel both for business or leisure.   The location was central and overlooking the sea, the hotel was beautiful and the staff excellent.   We were upgraded to a sea-facing room without charge and overall I would rate the hotel as excellent.

Stay, Comfort, Location, Sea View, etc excellent.
Only disappointment. Be careful as employees are very quick to print bill without allowing guests to check bill.

Expensive but I guess it's relative to the price of comfort in Mumbai

Decent hotel though

i enjoyed my stay at the trident nariman due to the location of the hotel to some wonderful sights, the quality of the food and the helpfulness of the staff. i do think that the quality of the complementary cocktail could have been better but the staff did everything they could to make the stay very pleasant indeed.

the mumbai indians, the indian cricket team, use this place as their base. had no interest for me, given i know nothing about cricket, but i guess it's an indication of the quality of the hotel, the service, the security, the facilities, the sum of the parts of a hotel really.

it was my first visit to mumbai, and i was surprised that the internet recommendations all seemed to recommend 5-star places, as i normally prefer boutique/cheaper places. so we bit the bullet and booked trident, and i'm very glad we did. we were given an upgrade without asking for one, securing us a lovely corner room with two views over the water. the food downstairs was great, the staff exemplary, the tourist attractions and business area in comfortable walking distance (for us, aged 30ish, maybe too far to some tourist attractions for older tourists). 

i'd recommend it highly.

Stayed 4 nights.. on the first 2 nights i was delivered freshly made chocolates in the room. These were lovely.
on the second two nights i did not recieve the chocolates, upon asking the service staff, they said its only for guests who stay 4 or more nights and chocolates are only given on the first 2 nights.. sniff sniff lol..
Service was very good throughout. Staff are friendly.
Overall i would say one of the best 5 star experiences in Mumbai.

Got upgraded to beautiful club sea facing room-was great experience
Hotel quite flexible about late check out-very courteous
Nice selection of resturants and bang in middle of south mumbai tony area
Hotel is recommended
It is expensive but then so are all hotels in Mumbai and this hotel offers all the necessary facilities for a very comfortable and good stay
would recommend this hotel for all and any purposes
also near all shopping etc
Lovely hotel. Great staff. Excellent location. Good food.

service is very satisfying, both in the front office and in the room. I was given late check out after the receptionist know my flight at midnight. they rent a local simcard, a thing that foreigner cant have.
the restaurants provide a very tasty menu, i only try two restaurant. 
but, theres no free wifi, even at the public area.

We had a perfect stay at this hotel.  We got a great price and got bumped up to a nicer room when we got there.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  The room was beautiful and spacious.  The location was perfect.  Would also definitely recommend eating at India Jones in the hotel- awesome meal.

i really enjoyed my stay at the trident. we had a wonderful view of marine drive from our room and it was a 5 star experience in every way. the staff were attentive and friendly, and the food was also excellent. i got a deal on this hotel, and it was considerably cheaper than other 5 star hotels in south bombay.
Frankly, eating expensive and the Internet as well as
Good hotel. Very good rooms, Staff is excellent. Food is awesome. Brilliant location.
I spent a few hours in the hotel room, freshening up and relaxing.  The rooms were business smart.  Service was prompt and friendly.  The 24 hours restaurant was good.  All in all, a pleasant stay.

Great property and centrally located. Clean and great service.
Fabulous concierge who go the extra mile.

The staff were ever-helpful. I've never had anyone said "no" to my requests - including free late check-out and a driver to the airport who charged within my low budget (over-spent on shopping). Breakfast was delicious and do not miss the Trident spa. It's not the cheapest spa but really nice. Also, do pay a bit more for a seaview room. The charming Arabian Sea sunset is too romantic to say no to.
It was a good stay as the room as well as the washroom were very clean and very friendly staff.

Smooth check-in.  Clean comfortable room - very comfortable bed.  Free fruit, coffee/tea and unlimited water.  Taps have drinking water too - so no plastic!  Cons are expensive room service, huge and impersonal, outdoor pool too windy and cold to use.
Great new rooms and the resturants are the top in the city
the hotel is very nice, very warm hospitality... very great staff... very friendly and helpful..room is very clean and decent...worth for 2nd visit
What a great place to stay. View is fantastic, room was lovely and staff were great

I only stayed at the Trident for one night, a quick business trip to Mumbai. I arrived in the early hours of the morning so it took less than 1hr for the taxi to reach the hotel. I booked a hotel car back to the airport, again later in the day (about 8pm) and it took 75 minutes... in the rush hour it would probably take much longer. The location is fine if you have meetings in that part of the city, and plenty of time to catch flights, but otherwise I might stay in one of the hotels closer to the airport.

The hotel is obviously expensive compared to most others (although not the most expensive on this site) so my expectations were high. The staff were friendly, and check-in was efficient. The hotel room was fine (I was upgraded to a sea view)... the hotel room was a little dated for my tastes, it would benefit from upgraded bathrooms etc. 

The internet was not free (it seems that the more expensive the hotel, the more likely they are to charge for internet access)... someone needs to tell them that free wifi is now expected by most travellers. 

There are a couple of restaurants in the basement, one only opens at 7.30pm... (the same time the buffet starts in the other) so maybe not great if you like to eat early. The a la carte is available all day... and was fine for me as quite suited to western tastes (a tuna sandwich and a pizza... I was playing it safe...)

i have stayed several times in this hitel and i was never disappointed in the quality of the services, cleaness of the both the room & the toilet, friendlyness of the staff & best of all the location in nariman point.  this location is near almost to everything except for the airport. it is located in the heart of the city near the important businesses & near most of the shopping area.  moreover, the shopping arcade within the hotel offers great shopping experience if you do not have the ample time to visit the city, prices are little higher but bazzar like atmosphere is common where you can negotiate almost anything. 30%-60% of the orginal price can be settled for.

This is a great hotel very conveniently situated for all local tourist points of interest just a very short taxi ride away. The hotel has a very pleasant relaxing atmosphere and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. The club room we stayed in was excellent with a great view of the bay the only downside was the bathroom was rather small. The condition of the swimming pool is looking a bit old and could do with updating We would definitely stay again.

Trident Nariman point is an excellent business,leisure hotel and hotel for all purposes located in marine drive south mumbai's poshest location

very close to nariman point,south mumbais other business and office areas and also very close to main south mumbai's designers shopping

rooms and toilets are very nice,staff is excellent and attentive

has galleria and oberoi mall attached to it for shopping and also has the best selection of 4-5 resturants and a bar

an excellent spa also and swimming pool

would recommend this hotel to anyone in mumbai and overall fantastic

some good deals to be had over internet
It is a very good hotel with good facilities .Handles of cupboards  in rooms are not user fiendly, better to be changed with proper handles with grip.

i stayed one week for a business trip.
the hotel is in a good location by the bay that feels relatively safe. the level of security was reassuring.
the room was spacious, had good lighting and was well appointed.
the desk was good and internet connection worked well.
the level of service was friendly and to a high standard.
there is a choice of places to eat: two restaurants and an area for light snacks in the lobby. food is good.
the outdoor pool area is a nice place to relax and swim.
at the top of the hotel there is a business area and meeting rooms.
i would recommend this hotel.

there is nothing i can say that was not 100% right in this hotel. the fact is , i am sure this hotel will get so many positive feedbacks it will become too popular and reservations will be hard to make ...or maybe price will go up. for this reason i leave it up to you to explore this hotel . enjoy your stay in mumbai !

The staff remember me and know what I like , every time I am there I get the same service and smiles. The rooms are very nice and for the price you are paying you are getting more than expected, comparing with any other hotel in Mumbai. Security is a bit loose lately . The gym is nice and the restaurants are the best , offering clean safe and delicious food ! Highly recommended !
Very good point of view,great pool and good facility

stayed here a few times and its better then ever....good service from a very nice staff.

the resturants and room service is great too, the italian food is great compred to many resturants i tried.

i get back from work and dont even need to leave the hotel.

Great location with very good view of the indian ocean. i was very delighted with the fact that they upgraded me to the executive floor without further charges. I would recommend eating in the hotel as the food is good and not pricey. the hotel is excellent for business travellers as it is located near many companies
the double bed was sloping towards either side causing instability and discomfort. The pillows were huge and uncomfortable.
Nice location, the security is good. But the food is expensive. Near the hotel have cinema theaters gate way of India is near by taxi 7min.

we buy voucher from agoda travel , trident is a comfortable hotel to stay for business trip . near to go craw ford market, but diffucult to call taxi. we must have rent the taxi for convinient,   nice swiming pool but not have sauna.
i really like the person in the reception and the hotel is very clean and nice i will return there
One of the best hotel to stay in Mumbai; service is good; food is excellent
I stayed for 3 days, service and location good
Was greeted by every hotel staff that I met. the atmosphere was good. Bed was comfortable.

Luxurious hotel at a good location in Mumbai. Hotel facilities have a high standard (incl. gymnasium). Lobby is very convenient to meet people and to enjoy an afternoon tea. Staff was friendly and helpful. All in all a very pleasant experience.
luxurious hotel at a very central location and a nice sea view. Staff was always very helpful and friendly. Excellent service. Good gymnasium facilities.
It was great.

We had a great stay at the Trident and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a place on Marine Drive in Mumbai.  The hotel had a great ambiance and the service is great.  The rooms could use an update as the furniture/carpet looks a little tired but everything within the rooms is still really clean.  I loved the gym as well.
always nice to come back to this welcoming hotel with great resturants and very nice rooms, its price isnt too bad as well.....i found a great deal on agoda.

my second time staying in the Trident hotel....biz again...great location and the service above all....
the price increased but stayed sain
Great for those going for biz....great price for the standart room

wow thank you trident its after  a long time i felt mumbai to be my favorite city 
Loved it thank you

My wife and I came to this hotel (then named Oberoi) years ago for a nice afternoon high tea, which we enjoyed very much. I didn't realize this until staying at the hotel for a few days. It made this stay a second delightful memory of the Trident Hotel.
It's definitely a good hotel to stay. Certainly will pay a visit in my next visit.
Area is good for business traveler
Location is perfect. We ordered room service and the food was excellent.

very nice rooms with or without sea view.very clean
the food is excelent ,the breakfast its very very good.ther is abig gym and aswwiming pool pluse sauna and steam room.you have also big beutey center
and abig shoping center tuch to the hotel.

hotel security is tight but that is understanable. it has a convenience link to the new oberoi hotel. cabs is easy to get outside. they have some nice boutique shops at the corner which is convenient for last minute shopping. hotel staff is pleasant and approachable. room are standard size but toilet a bit too small. would i stay again?...probably.

This hotel is beginning to show its age but still has a relaxed charm and cleanliness ideal for India.  The choice of venues within the hotel is linited - frangipani restaurant is excellent, india jones is average and the bar is characterless.
The lobby area is noisy and busy so nowhere private to meet.

The first thing you like is the way people grant you with smile. Spacious place, clean. For people who work in finance you are ideally based. On 6 meetings I had, 5 was less than a minute walk !!!
See sight give you also a good way to come back.

The hotel was located in a great location; however, the room was big and nice. The bathroom was so bogt fiance' and I could fit in the bathroom at one time. The hotel as very clean overall; however,  and the cleaning crew always have a set schedule.

The best hotel in the neighbourhood, I have checked them all.
All Indian hotels I stayed at had breakfast included except: The Trident, what a surprise!
For 5 stars the room could have better room maintenance
Plentiful and knowledgeable restaurant staff
Fitness room and steam room very good and good staff there

A great hotel at an excellent location for business and pleasure.Amazing choice of resturants in the hotel as well as other fcailities.Some rooms till the 17th floor are old fashioned and need renovation.Rest nothing much to complain about the hotel.Excellent sea-view also.Service and staff helpfulness and friendliness is very good.

moved here after 2 nites not sleeping at another place. what a delight. the sheets enveloped me + i slept like a baby. nariman pt isn't my fave location, but taxis r cheap-i view is great.booked thru agoda-day i moved in-got great price-even trident wouldn't meet it.

Trident Hilton is one of mumbais oldest and best hotels.It has a wide array of resturants and excellent location with great shopping at their shopping arcade.However some of the rooms are really old fashioned and need renovation and a modern getup.I understand till 18th floors are the older rooms.No other complaints from the hotel-among the best
I feel better than last time stayed because there are good service both of hotel facilities and hotel staff. Finally, I prefered to stay at this hotel in the next time

Muy c√≥modo todo y la atenci√≥n del personal muy buena. La piscina y el gimnasio excelentes.La habitaci√≥n y el servicio de habitaciones tambi√©n muy c√≥modo. Recomendable si se quieren visitar cosas en la ciudad.

Hotel excellent. 
Tout est fait pour rendre le s√©jour agr√©able. 
La bonne disponibilit√© et l'amabilit√© du personnel d'accueil , de salle et des chambres  sont √† f√©liciter
Le rapport qualit√© prix. L‚Äôh√¥tel est tr√®s bien mais cher par rapport au march√© indien

Nous avons s√©journe une nuit avec une copine lors de notre visite a Mumbai. Emplacement parfait ! chambre de bonne taille et petit d√©jeuner tres bon. La piscine avec vue sur la mer permet d'assister au couche du soleil avec une bonne journee de visite.
Superbe h√¥tel avec tous les services que l on peut en attendre
Absolument sans soucis c'est le propre des palaces.

Tres bon s√©jour dans cet hotel. La situation est id√©ale pour d√©couvrir la ville.
Les chambres sont spacieuse. La vue sur l'oc√©an √©tait sublime.
Rien √† dire sur le petit d√©jeuner, cetait parfait !
Court s√©jour au Trident mais superbe souvenirs. 2 nuits dans un confort haut de gamme, extr√™mement bien plac√© pour rayonner dans la ville.

Il semble que les hotels de la cha√Æne Trident respectent toujours leur promesses. Les hotels sont propres, le service y est imp√©cable. Apr√®s une journ√©e dans la cohue de Bombay, nous avons vraiment appr√©ci√© le calme et l'air frais de la terrasse √† la piscine. L'hotel est tr√®s bien situ√© si on veut visiter √† pied. Nous reviendrons certainement dans cet hotel.
une seule phrase : √† recommander!

Es war fantastisch!
Ein Aufenthalt hier an bester Lage ist grossartig, alles perfekt, es gibt nichts zu bem√§ngeln.
Cooles Hotel!!

Fragte zweimal f√ºr ein gro√ües Bett anstatt 2 Einzelbetten.
Leider erfolglos!!
Auch bei der Bestellung kreuzte ich 2mal diesen Wunsch an. Auch dies erfolglos
Alles nur leere Versprechungen!!!

Leider haben wir den negativen Stimmen zu wenig Beachtung geschenkt und trotzdem ein Zimmer im Trident gebucht. Das war ein Fehler. Denn das Trident ist definitiv kein 5 Sterne Hotel. Wer mit uns nicht einer Meinung ist, sollte bei n√§chster Gelegenheit unbedingt einmal im Four Seasons, im Oberoi oder im Taj Mahal Palace logieren.

Unser Zimmer konnten wir erst nach √ºber einer Stunde Wartezeit beziehen und mussten dann feststellen, dass die R√§ume weder aufger√§umt noch gereinigt waren. Das Housekeeping musste mit zwei Personen volle zwanzig Minuten nachreinigen. Hinzu kommt, dass unsere Suite (Room No. 3234) bereits weit √ºber das Verfalldatum hinaus war. Die M√∂bel sind zerkratzt und abgewohnt, Bez√ºge teils dreckig und speckig, der Teppich fleckig und ausgefranzt. Das Bad hat schon bessere Tage gesehen (Schimmel, Flecken im Lavabo!) und die Klimaanlage liess sich leider nicht richtig regulieren, so dass wir w√§hrend der Nacht gerademal gef√ºhlte 20 Grad im Zimmer hatten. 

Die Mitarbeiter sind bem√ºht aber auch schnell am Anschlag und zum Teil mit allt√§glichen Situationen restlos √ºberfordert. 

Das ganze Hotel ist stark heruntergek√ºhlt und in den √∂ffentlichen Bereichen (Bar, Restaurants, Lobby, etc.) geradezu unangenehm kalt. Man ben√∂tigt Jacke und Schal, damit man nicht friert. 

Das Essen wiederum war sehr gut und von hoher Qualit√§t. 

Auch die Poollandschaft ist sehr gepflegt und die Bedienung aufmerksam und professionell.

Wir k√∂nnen das Trident trotzdem nicht weiter empfehlen. Dies ist kein 5 Sterne Hotel, weder beim Gesamtauftritt, bei den Angeboten noch bei den (nicht!) erbrachten Services. Das Hotel ist in die Jahre gekommen und ein Stern dabei wohl abhandengekommen. Die Angebote f√ºr Zimmer und Suiten m√∂gen attraktiv sein, summa summarum aber trotzdem den Preis nicht wert.
ruhiger Fels in der Brandung der hektioschen Grossstadt
Perfekter Auftakt fuer eine Indienreise
Sehr angenehm, genau das richtige zum erholen nach anstrengenden Besichtigungen. Schade war nur, dass der Pool so sehr kalt war und das WiFi extra teuer bezahlt werden musste.

Im Vergleich zu einem europ√§ischen 5-Sterne-Hotel waren die Zimmer nicht vergleichbar: eben nicht makellos, aber ordentlich. Unverst√§ndlich ist, warum der Pool nicht ein bisschen geheizt wird; das ist im Dezember in Mumbai durchaus angebracht. Man wird auch nach 10 Minuten durchkraulen nicht warm. Ein Gast sagte mir im Dampfbad, dass das der Grund f√ºr ihn ist, nicht mehr in dieses Hotel zu fahren.So weit w√ºrde ich nicht gehen, aber es ist nicht 5-Sterne-Standard. Die Gegend um das Hotel ist ruhig, wenn man das mag.

W-Lan kostenpflichtig -- f√ºr ein 5 Sterne Hotel inakzeptabel.
Noch dazu zu diesen hohen Preisen.

Obwohl um 3:00 morgens angekommen, sehr freundliche Aufnahme. Zimmerservice hervorragend, Klimatisierung sehr gut, ruhige Zimmer auch wenn umgeben vom Familien mit Kindern. Restaurants bieten morgens, aber auch sonst, eine Vielfalt an kulinarischen Gen√ºsse f√ºr jeden Geschmack. Im gegenteil zu mir, mag meine Frau keine stark gew√ºrzten Gerichte. Wir waren beide sehr zufrieden. Auch die musikalische Einlage des Pianisten abends in der Lobby vermissen wir jetzt schon.

Man kann schoen am Marine Drive laufen und Sonnenuntergang geniessen. Zum Taj Mahal Hotel/Gateway of India ist es ca 1/2 Std zu Fuss. Um die Ecke ist ein Kinocenter und Restaurants.
Man sollte das Fruehstueck mitbuchen, das ist relativ teuer im Hotel, oder man geht zu Fuss und fruehstueckt in einem Caf√©.
Wenn der Preis stimmt, wuerde ich immer wieder kommen.
Ich habe im Trident sogar besseren Service als in deutschen 5Sterne Hotel erlebt. Das Personal ist bestens geschult und macht alles moeglich. Es gibt keinen Wunsch der nicht erfuellt wird.

Im hektischen Gro√üstadtdschungel von Mumbai braucht man einen sch√∂nen, sauberen, freundlichen R√ºckzugspunkt, z.B. das Trident der Oberoi Gruppe!Vor allem die Concierge Mitarbeiter waren sehr hilfsbereit bzgl. Adressen und Tischreservierungen sowie Tipps f√ºr die meist sehr schlecht Englisch sprechenden Taxifahrer.
Das Zimmer war gro√üz√ºgig gestaltet, der Pool samt Sonnenuntergang sehr sch√∂n!!
Auch das Fr√ºhst√ºcksbuffett war sehr gut sortiert f√ºr jeden Geschmack der internationalen Klientel mit freundlichem Personal.
Im S√ºden der Stadt gelegen ist es nur eine kurze Taxifahrt zum Taj Palace Hotel am Gate of India. Hier spr√ºht die Stadt vor Energie und hier kann man durchaus gute tour guides durch Mumbai finden. Auch abends ist die Gegend abgenehm zum Spazierengehen und Sich-treiben-lassen. Wir haben den Aufenthalt rundum genossen, im Verkehrswahnsinn der Stadt ist das Trident eine "kleine angenehme Oase".

kompetentes Personal
sehr erholsam nach dem Sightseeing

die Atmosph√§re des Hotels ist sehr gut, die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich, sehr gutes Fr√ºhst√ºck, Lage des Hotels f√ºr Mumbai optimal, Mitarbeiter gaben sehr gute Tipps f√ºr Ausfl√ºge - in unserem Fall stellten sie die Verbindung zu reality-tours her, um eine Fahrt in die Slums zu machen, sehr guter Service auch bei der Abreise. Am Abreisetag konnten wir uns bis zum sp√§ten Abend im Hotel und auch im Poolbereich aufhalten, da unser Flug erst um 2.30h ging.

die vorhandenden sicherheitsvorkehrungen fuer dieses hotel, bishin zu mit machinengewehr hinter sandsack burgen postierten soldaten war zu naechst ziemlich gewoehnungsbedurftig. nach relativ kurze zeit fuehrte diese bewachung zu einem angenehmen sicherheitsgefuehl. (anschlaege im november 2008). es war sehr einfach ein taxi preisguenstig mit einem  englisch sprechenden fahrer zu bekommen.es    wird sehr die snackbar in der lounge des hotels fuer fruehstueck und zwischen mahlzeiten empfohlen .
Ottimo albergo, straordinariamente gentile e attento lo staff, eccezionale la colazione.

classico hotel internazionale. camere un po' retro ma molto pulite e personale gentilissimo. sempre pronti a dare consigli su cose da fare e ristoranti. il personale √® davvero la cosa migliore dell'hotel. grandissima scelta a colazione. posizione molto interessante per riuscire a vedere alcune cose di mumbai a piedi.
Ottima struttura con personale cordiale.posizione comoda

la camera √® molto pulita e la vista sulla baia √® fantastica, i servizi comuni sono inuumerevoli (ristoranti, bar, spa, sauna, piscina, negozi), il personale √® molto cordiale e cerca di soddisfare tutte le esigenze del cliente.

**Feedback for Sahara Star Mumbai Hotel**

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Sahara Star, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience. Here are a few highlights:

**1. Exceptional Service:**  
From the moment I arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive. The check-in process was smooth, and the concierge team was helpful in arranging my activities.

**2. Stunning Ambiance:**  
The hotel has a unique design that beautifully blends luxury and nature. The indoor lagoon and tropical landscaping create a serene atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for relaxation.

**3. Immaculate Rooms:**  
My room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and impeccably clean. The amenities provided were top-notch, making my stay even more comfortable.

**4. Delicious Dining Options:**  
The variety of restaurants offered a wide range of cuisines. I particularly enjoyed dining at [specific restaurant name], where the dishes were not only tasty but presented beautifully.

**5. Excellent Location:**  
The hotel‚Äôs location is convenient, making it easy to access local attractions and the airport. This made my travel around Mumbai a breeze.

**6. Incredible Facilities:**  
The spa and fitness center were fantastic. I indulged in a relaxing massage that was just what I needed after a busy day.

Overall, my stay at Sahara Star was absolutely remarkable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and enjoyable experience in Mumbai. I can‚Äôt wait to  retrun

This is a popular hotel with some good dining options. Located very close to domestic airport terminal in Mumbai. In general rooms were clean and had all basic amenities. Staff needs to check that all plug points are working as we charge multiple devices these days. The hotel lobby also needs some more seating/ sprucing up.

I booked with agoda and had great experience, plus express checkin on mentioned time, great price for such a amazing property, staff was really nice and they upgraded us to great view room with minimum cost. Agoda is really recommend by me for budget traveling. I had great experience using this application. Overall great experience 5 star rating from my side.
It‚Äôs an iconic Mumbai luxury with a spectacular ambience. Great place to stay and enjoy‚Ä¶. Excellent restaurants, cuisines and service.

This hotel is located at a great place, so near to T1. I stayed for a day as I had to catch my connecting international flight. Room is good, nice and clean! I had to wait a bit for check-in and looks like there is no line policy which was different experience for me (this anyway has in India and people serving does not enforce it :( ). Any way's other than that all good..comfortable bed..great food..nice ambience..all good..would stay here again if come again to Mumbai.
you will never get disappointed at the service
Old but still good hotel

Absolute classic, felt privileged to stay in this masterpiece & every corner of this  hotel is luxury.  
Historic hotel and pride of India.

The hotel is perfect in every way. It feels like walking in a museum with all the ancient art in the hallways.
The service was really perfect. Our kid received so many presents.

Great stay,wonderful staff,fab facilities. Thank you

luxurious, elegant, discreet.  Booked a tower room, they gave me an upgrade. I ll thank them for ever.  Travel alone , sometimes u feel lonley, but they let me feel cuddled.  One night is not enough to enjoy all the facilities, hope next time to be able to stay more
We stayed in the tower and it was worth the money to have this experience.

Five Stars all the way. Impeccable Service throughout the property. Even though it is 115 years old, everything is perfectly maintained and looks new. The Concierge is perhaps the best at any hotel...genuinely helpful all the time.
Cannot find any faults

One of the best hotels I have stayed in. More luxurious then you can imagine. A quirky mix of old colonial British and Indian luxury combines. Pool area fantastic and spa out of this world. Well worth a stay!
Absolutely amazing hotel - a delight on every level from check-in to check-out. The pool would have to be one of the best in Asia.

The location is nice but not very convenient. Service is very good matching its 5-star rating. But the WIFI on its complimentary plan is quite slow, which matters more than to most guests than services like flower petals  in the room etc.
This is the best hotel in Mumbai. Anyone visiting Mumbai must experience the luxury and Royalty by staying at Taj Mahal Tower.
Had a great stay and they were so helpful
Very Good Service , Fast Check In Fantastic will definetly come back

I booked this as a treat of for 2 of my friends and they had the worst experience ever! 
We were unpleasantly surprised and disappointed at the standard of the room & services , especially at a hotel like the Taj, which has a stellar reputation of unparalleled luxury! My guests room in the Tower section of the hotel had bedbugs! My friends who went back to a family member‚Äôs home in Bombay was getting her clothes washed when the maid noticed the bugs! They had to get everything in her luggage and the whole house, including the curtains, bedspreads & cushioning boiled, steamed and then laundered! Though age had spotted bugs along the paneling on the walls, she didn‚Äôt want to create a big deal till she got home and Mainly because she  didn‚Äôt think that they would have got into her luggage! To top everything everything off they can‚Äôt even make a decent milkshake by the poolside! Even after informing them  that they haven‚Äôt stirred it well and that the cocoa is all stuck to the bottom and that it all you get through the straw is cocoa, they didn‚Äôt attempt to redo it or to offer us another one and they made it exactly the same way the next day as well! I‚Äôm appalled that though we have informed them, nobody has gotten back to us!

The service is the first thing I want to write about. Absolutely impeccable! From reception to housekeeping and breakfast staff, everyone cared incredibly to make sure we had a positive stay. The room was beautifully designed with a high ceiling and nice decorations. Stay here for  a fabulous experience in Mumbai. Walking distance to good restaurants and super close to Colaba Causeway for some shopping.
Nice hotel good location and good breakfast

The breakfast was semi-buffet style but there was a separate gluten free area. 
We can't wait to visit again.

For the price I paid

Stayed at the palace wing with club facilities. It was fantastic.
Superb, couldn't do enough for you. Friendly helpful top quality

Upgraded to Club level.  Staff very accommodating and went out of their  way to anticipate any needs we might have had. Also  we were informed of special programs offered at hotel.   Breakfast is extensive and delicious

The Taj Mahal Palace is an impressive Grand Hotel, how you imagine it should be. Location, service, view, stuff - whatever you are talking about.
Only disadvantage are the prices in the restaurants - they are also grand. Especially if you compare it to the price level around. But overall a must in Mumbai.

The hotel was superb. Attention to detail was 100% and the staff were delightful. The buffet breakfast had something for every taste in the huge choice on offer. Pool area was very pretty. Also very high level of security around the hotel. Recommend this hotel as the best place to stay for your Bombay experience.
very good hotel
Lovely old turn of the century hotel meticulously maintained and upgraded.  Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.  Great service.  Would stay here again.

The gem of Mumbai, an extraordinary hotel, incredible location, wonderful swimming pool, delightful staff, delicious breakfast buffet, amazing rooms... I am a repeat visitor and will never consider staying anywhere else when in Mumbai.

Excellent location, Knowledgable and courteous staff. 
Could be more helpful with the facilities and services. Overall they were very nice but need more activities for small children and entertainment.
very good
The place is good, but didn't like the food , the pay more attention to " How the dish look" than  the taste of the dish

Taj created a wonderful hiatus in time

We were cared for, looked after and pampered 

After meandering through 84 countries, all of which God created in their own individual beauty, it took Taj to show us a genuine patch of perfection

Thank you

Alex and Usha
Lovely place, food and drink are grossly overpriced, clean & tidy, pleasant helpful staff.  But for upmarket hotels I think Raffles in Singapore just has the edge on it!

The hotel is steeped in history and magnificent, the location is brilliant, however the prices are exorbitant and the room was not cleaned properly from the last occupant.....there was toe nails on the floor.
Your staff were beyond excellent.

From the moment you arrive there are warm welcomes and many unexpected extras. We were upgraded to the magnificent heritage palace wing and everything was catered for, even before you realised you needed something, it was there. Yes you do pay more for everything, but the service, surrounds and attention to detail are worth it for a special treat. Our only slight negative was the quality of food at the Golden Dragon, which claims to be a Sichuan restaurant, but falls a little short of the mark.
Luxury accommodation
Beautiful hotel which 100  years of history. Professional well trained staff make the experience even better.
definitely will go back
Good view, clean room, and nice ambience
Lovely hotel with excellent staff and facilities
Staff excellent
Everything was great.
Good food, good ambience, luxury hotel

If you want to experience something very special than visit this place. History goes along with an outstanding service and beautiful views. Take a room in the old part of the hotel which is more expensive but so much more unforgetable. If you have a chance get a room with view of the ocean and the gate of India. A great experience will wait for you!
Friendly, professional, comfortable; an excellent hotel - we will visit again
Sumptuous rooms. The heritage tour was very interesting.

This is a magnificent establishment, and I'm pleased my group decided to stay here for a night after having spent 2 weeks trekking through the Himalaya sleeping in tents! We were a bit embarrassed arriving with backpacks etc, but the staff were wonderful and we even received upgrades. My only disappointment was our stay was too short!

The Taj Palace hotel is one of my best hotel experiences thus far.  From the moment I arrived I was made to feel special by the hotel staff.  My stay was during Diwali 2016 and the hotel as adorned is Diwali ornaments and decorations.  At the reception desk, Priyanka greeted me with a smile and was extremely helpful.  I had an early check-in and she upgraded my room.  Thanks Priyanka.  My room came with butler service and provided fresh fruits which I requested.  The rooms are spacious and well designed.    A staff member escorted me to my room and made sure all was just right.  The property is gorgeous and not far from many attractions and sightseeing i.e. India‚Äôs Gateway.   Overall, great staff, rooms, service, and location.  I really enjoyed my stay at the Taj Palace Hotel and look forward to my next stay when I‚Äôm back in Mumbai.
Would recommend to anyone wanting an unforgettable  experience
Loved my stay here.  Absolutely A+.  Staff was fantastic, hotel was amazing, everything about my stay was great and I don't say that lightly.

All staff were just so welcoming and polite.
Hotel is impeccably clean. Lots of fine furniture, display items around and the location is great.
Pool area was lovely. Choice of eateries.
5 star.
It was so beautiful stay & wish we could stay longer.

Our superior king city view room was in the palace wing of the Taj. The charm of the palace wing is unmatchable. The team did up our room with lovely decor & filled with balloons since its our wedding anniversary. We even celebrated with a small size chocolate cake, compliments from the hotel. 

My wife had a pleasant surprise when the room attendant Keton & housekeeper Saksham left a pouch of indian accessories on the desk. She was delighted as its in time for our dinner at Souk. It matches her outfit too!

In particular, we enjoyed having breakfast at Shamiana instead of the Sea Lounge as Magalhaes was always there to brighten our mornings.  His service is commendable!

Taj is definately an experience you will remember and we are looking forward to coming back. Oh I almost forgot...u must join the daily tour of the hotel. Don't miss it.

Nothing here is a problem for management or staff. All performed beyond expectations and nothing was to much trouble. We received a most unexpected upgrade to a suite and when asked why, "because we can" was their response. The food and wine was varied and fairly priced. We ate at the Indian restaurant which was fantastic, excellent service. Breakfast buffet was outstanding.  Nothing was out of place and if you intend going to Udaipur this is a must. Beautiful. We will return and recommend it highly.
Very beautiful and the best location. The starbuck coffee just in the same building
Very comfortable rooms and very delecious food
enjoyed my stay
Service

The room pictures and room were completely different. You had suite pictures for a normal room. The room service had the worst pasta I have eaten in my whole life. Disappointed as I am also an inner circle member of the last 6 years.
Excellent facilities with high level of Staff hospitality
A special night to spoil ourselves

From the time l checked in, when l was offered an upgrade wt a sea-view, until l checked out, l was treated like royalty. Every staff member l encountered went 'above & beyond' to assure that my time there was happy.
The evening tour was particularly interesting & informative.
Breakfast was sumptuous & service superb.
Every corner of the hotel exudes charm & grace.
The Taj is not somewhere to sleep, it's an experience.
Thank you.
We had the best time ever!

We really enjoyed our stay last weekend. Kids enjoyed it the most. Not a complaint but more of a feedback is that pool could be little more kids friendly (depth was a bit high). A game room or recreation room would have been great as well.

Loved it regardless!!!
Excellent in all aspects!
Perfect

Location of the hotel is just too beautiful and coupled with the impeccable service offered by the staff is just too good. Keep it up and I recommend to each one visiting Mumbai..shd stay at Taj Mahal Palace and experience the grand ambiance and early sunrise from the hotel room.
The absolute best service I've ever had by the most respectful and pleasant staff. And the marble bathrooms are terrific.
the rooms were not as great as expected. however, the service more than made up for it. the Sea Lounge served an excellent high-tea. The breakfast was high quality. overall, a great experience.
A wonderful experience in a Mumbai institution.  The staff really looked after us during our stay.

I have travelled a lot and always stayed in a variety of Hotels but there is none to beat Taj Mahal Palace  Hotel in Gateway Mumbai. From the time you enter to the time you leave everything is so perfect be it friendly staff to cleanliness. Please always stay this way!

During our 3 day stay we encountered a most friendly and efficienct staff. The ambiance is wonderfull and our luxurious room in the Palace wing was extraordinary. Great Breakfast buffet. 
One of the world's best Hotel.
I cannot fault my experience at the Taj. The stay was amazing...

The hotel is beautiful. Lots of heritage and character but modern finishes and comfort. We loved the pool, breakfast, all the restaurants were good and the location was perfect as a first time tourist in Mumbai. 

The staff were all very friendly and nothing was a problem.
Palace service was superbly excellent. I've stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and Taj still managed to pleasantly impress. I will definitely come back again!
Good location
Overall a great hotel.
Highly recommended
Lived up to its reputation.
if you go to Mumbai it has to be this hotel
Fantastic

The Taj Mahal Palace is obviously THE place to stay in Mumbai but it lets itself down on a couple of minor points that shouldn't happen in a top class hotel.
The extras details in the bathroom were a bit basic and the safe was too small to take a small size laptop. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Lovely gardens and pool. Superb location.
Excellent night

Our stay at the Taj was absolutely superb.  The staff are very polite,  friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good with a variety of food. The room was clean and very nice. We enjoyed our 2 nights at The Taj and look forward to staying there soon.
The only negative was the bad quality of wine and drinks. The internet was also very slow and we lost the connection all the time. The breakfast in the Sea Lounge was excellent!

Fantastic 
Want to go again
Excellent
We have an excellent stay at this hotel and for sure will come back again.
It's a magic place.

Everything about our stay at the Taj Mahal Palace was superb. However, we were disappointed by the description of the view from the bedroom window!

We  booked a "Deluxe Harbour View" room but the only way we could actually see the 'harbour' was to put our faces up against the window and look to the right, at which point we were able to see a corner of it. Standing 'in' the centre of the room, the view was of a wall of the new Taj Mahal wall which stands in front of the 'old'. Had I known this was to be the case, I would have booked a different room.

Whoever wrote the view description had a very inventive mind!
Hotel most accommodating for our early arrival and a late departure. Take the free daily tour of the hotel to learn about the building and some history. Staff very helpful.

We had requested a non-smoking room in the tower. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a suite in the Palace, however, we were not informed that it was a smoking suite. Not good if you have asthma. Other than that, we were satisfied.
From booking in through to leaving all staff seemed exceptionally well organised, friendly and eager to please.   The stay at this hotel was a delightful and memorable experience.
We had the most amazing time the staff were excellent and location was perfect for our first time to Mumbai we plan to revisit I'm October.

The hotel is fantastic in every way. It's an impeccably well run hospitality oasis close to most major attractions in Mumbai, and great shopping.

The staff is professional, prompt and highly discreet. The food is excellent, as is room service. The gym, spa and hotel pool are well maintained - in particular the pool is an experience of its own.

I can't say enough about this hotel. As someone who travels about 150 days a year all over the world I can say with confidence that this is one of the very best hotels in the world.
It was awesome
Service, location, room, breakfast, atmosphere everything was excellent! I will be coming back!
will stay in this hotel all of my future stay.

We encountered serious problems in the hot water pipeline wherein rusty water with metal chips kept coming the room till we had to call the technician. Certainly not expected with Taj. Rest of the experience is wonderful as you can expect it in this hotel....Will visit again but hopefully we'll have no troubles like this time....
Excellent hotel.
Near Perfect

As usual, every time we visit the Taj Mahal Palace we are greeted as a special guest.  Their breakfast is fantastic, providing quality food and service.  Their rooms are well designed and offer a comfortable stay.

Beautiful, couldn't have stayed at a better hotel to round off my 30 days overseas. Staff were very competent and extremely polite and friendly. The booking in and exit were handled professionally and room service was very good. The barbque at the pool area was extremely good with excellent food choices. Breakfast was ample with a large variety to serve all tastes. Well done, I'll definitely be back to stay at the hotel.
Fantastic!
Third time at the Taj over a span of 10 years and already looking forward to going back. Superb!

This is undoubtedly one of the great hotel properties in India.

I think I will only stay here when visiting Mumbai in the future.

Great experience all round.

We had a wonderful stay beginning with a very personal and efficient check in process, and continuing with superb service all through our time at the Taj. The ambiance of this hotel is truly unique. The location overviewing the Gateway of India is fantastic and a high level floor with view towards the water is definitely recommendable.
We enjoyed the Palace Lounge as a tranquil sophisticated retrait also very much.
All in all, the Taj is THE hotel in Mumbai.

The hotel is a beautiful example of colonial architecture.  I stayed in the old wing which was superb however a friend that I was traveling with was in the new wing and experienced multiple problems in the room such as AC, Windows, noise of construction etc.  staff service is generally of a very high standard however it is variable and inconsistent particularly around the pool area.
This hotel can only be described as a little piece of heaven on earth. Superb in everything.
Excellent, will happily go back
Excellent

I can say that during my visit to Mumbai,  staying at Taj mahal is my best experience.  Mumbai it self is not tourist friendly. 
The location very strategic,  the room very big and comfortable. 
Staff service is very good,  especially staff at restaurant while breakfast. 
This hotel also is a historical building, that's why for first timer in Mumbai, you must stay here. 

Unfortunately the restaurant inside is very expensive. We try the Japanese restaurant which cost usd 150 for 2 person for a little order only. 
Anyway, I would come back here again

My son and I stayed for two nights and had an extremely enjoyable stay.  The staff are wonderful, the room perfect, pool lovely and breakfast delicious. can't understand why no breakfast for booking a 5-star hotel, and the wifi speed sure as hell doesn't match the name of a 5-star

Very comfortable and relaxing. We were greeted by all staff who we passed by either walking along the corridor, to the restaurants, shopping mall etc. This time it was 2 nights next time will stay a bit longer. Worth every penny,what a surprise upgrade to Taj Palace.
Fantastic

Outstanding hotel
I stay in 5 star hotels every month but the taj must be one of the best  in the world
outstanding staff - especially at club level

Made a reservation with Taj for pick up at the int  airport early morning at 5, worked wery smoothly, at 6 a clock il was walking in to the reception.
Had a room with city view. Comfy bed all product you need in the bathroom.

Il love the pool area. The pool man help you to at sun bed and provide you with thowels and bottle of water. If you need a locker room to change go down to the spa, there you allsow will find steam room and sauna.

TAJ  have several different restaurants and my favorite I Wasabi, next time I'll will only order dumplings, they are so tasty.

The breakfast buffe is lovely with everything you need.


Il be back in January 2016.

From the moment the family walked through the entrance and were greeted by the staff we knew we had arrived somewhere special.  We were personally escorted to our rooms by Zeena, who looked after us superbly throughout our stay.  We were travelling with young children who were amazed to find their room decorated with balloons and gifts.  The rooms within the Palace were just a delight to be in as was the constant attention to detail from the turn down service to the beautiful rose petal designs left in the room after cleaning.  Its obvious that all the staff love working there and it really is an Indian Institution that all should sample.  We can not recommend this hotel enough.
I had a great time, the Heritage Trail was an eye opener

Be careful one detail, this hotel have 2 buildings, old that is really crazy amazing and new that don‚Äôt have any novelty. Check to book a palace room as that part of the hotel is 100 + years old.
The service is very good, all staff are always happy. The only that I didn‚Äôt like too much was the breakfast, anyway is just a personal feeling, but is 5 stars anyway, and the internet cuts a lot, but the rest, this hotel is perfect. 100% recommended.
Excellent location. Probably the best property in Mumbai.

The service at this hotel is over the top. I have stayed at over a 100 hotels in 50 countries in the last 6 years and I would rank the Taj Mahal Palace Mumbai as #1 in service, luxury, comfort, food quality and style. I highly recommend this restaurant. They deserve a 5+ star rating and a 10.0 rating on the hotel scale.

It was great experience to stay at Taj Mahal palace wish to come again n again warm welcome, super delivery of room , everyone who wish to make there stay memorable I would recommend visit once will love to stay again n again.
