Wonderful, superb, They came to know that its our marriage anniversary and we were amazed by the gifts , cake, champagne, flowers. Not only this my kid was taken care also.. Dance class for him, then drawing book for him so that he enjoys his stay.

wonderful front desk ladies who were prompt, joyful, respecting, attentive, vibrant and happy to help. My family got overwhelmed by the service .

Great stay for those who want to be treated like royalty. Everything was great. My only reservation was that they were too attentive, we were asked if we needed anything about 10 times in a day. A little tiresome, but everything was great when we actually did need help with packing a parcel. They provided everything we needed. All in all, it was great, the room was nice, the breakfast was delicious, staff were very accomodating, the location was perfect for most tourist sites. Highly recommend this place. Thank you!
Comfortable, historic, enjoyable
Simply the BEST!
Comfortable, superb staff, service & hospitality. Our stay here will be difficult to beat elsewhere

I have been visiting india and particularly Mumbai for most of my years, generally on an annual basis and especially in the last 8 years each time visiting another city and returning to mumbai.
I have stayed in hostels in dongri, in bhendi bazaar and new bombai. Each time experiencing something new, but I know that now I will find it really difficult to stay anywhere else.
The Taj is more than a home away from home
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, but my purse does not feel the same

It's my third time in Taj Mahal Palace , and I got the chance to stay in the palace section this time with my wife , she really enjoyed her stay and asked me to take her back to it again. Mumbai is one of the cities that I really love and can't get enough of. The Staff is friendly and the breakfast is good. Taj Mahal Palace will be always my first choice whenever I am in Mumbai
A step back in time. One of the world's classic hotels.
Fabuloud

I cannot rate this hotel high enough. From a luxury point of view, it is amazing and the hotel is beautiful. But the service was just incredible and is what sets it above others. We arrived about 5.30am and we told we could pay a half board to have the room ready by 7am. This gave us time to have breakfast in quiet surroundings with a personal butler. To continue the great service we were upgraded to the Palace side which I would recommend paying more to stay in anyway. Each night we came back to our room to find personal gifts such as cake, silk scarves, Indian jewellery and one night 2 foot bathes were set up for my husband and I - the water was promptly delivered for us. Just what we needed after walking a lot in the heat. Relaxing in the pool each afternoon was also wonderful, and again the service by the pool staff was fantastic. Compared to other countries, the prices for accommodation and breakfast was very reasonable and so worth it.
In Mumbai, I would say go to Leopolds for beer and cheap curry, good fun and great taste. To upgrade a little, there is a local restaurant not far called Khyber - best Indian food we have ever had. 
With the help of a Dharavi local based tour company, Mystical Mumbai, we had an eye opening tour of the slum which we recommend. Make sure you check the taxi meters are on and you can rent a taxi for about 350 rupees an hour. Colabar Causeway is excellent for bartering for anything and the local shops along here, although generally fixed price, are still very cheap for well made Indian cotton clothing.
The stay at the Taj was a sheer delight. The staff where so attentive and made you feel very special. My stay was perfect.
Good
Very excellent

Extraordinary. Exceeded what were already very high expectations based on last time. Faultess. Staff go out of their way and over and above every time. Truly one of the best hotel stays anywhere on this planet.
We asked the reception for connecting room . They told your requested under process until the last no body update us

It's one of the best hotels not only in India but the world!! 

A trip to India isn't complete without a stay at The Taj!! 

Everything about the Taj Mahal Palace hotel is delightful - the architecture, the service quality, the spa, the people, the food!!
Excellent hotel the service is good i will recommend this hotel they hv nice rooms

I have stayed at the taj palace 3 times in the last 12 months & simply can't get enough. The moment you walk in to the hotel & the beautiful scent that is there my wife just can't get enough of it. We were given a sea view room which made our trip that extra special. The breakfast was quite a variety and delicious, looking forward to the next trip.
Excellent
Perfect, it always is!

The service staff were friendly, attentive and went the extra miles to ensure I have a good stay in the hotel. Situated in Colaba, it is easily accessible to places such as Gateway of India and cafes. Lastly, if you do not want to venture to combat with the traffic, the crowd or theheat, there are many activities and restaurants within the hotels to keep your time well- spent.
Excellent
The best hotel I have ever stayed in - wonderful staff, great swimming pool and wonderful history

Brilliant

Truly magical stay!

Service was beyond compare and whilst expensive to stay represented superb value for money.
The ambience through the entire hotel was amazing.

We ate twice at the Masala Kraft restaurant and the food was simply fantastic, the Sketch menu was outstanding value as it was cooked fresh in front of you at your table and the Chef explained everything to do with the meal.

It is hard to put in to words how wonderful the staff were. From the front desk and check in to the house staff to the management...everyone was dedicated to ensuring a wonderful stay.

The Palace wing is steeped in atmosphere and ambience and was amazing.

As we were in the Taj Club section and were very lucky in that the hotel upgraded us to a suite we also had the high tea element, free cocktails, free cognac & chocolates and free tea and coffee throughout the stay in the Palace Lounge. A free transfer from the airport to the Taj was included as was breakfast.

The stay was not just a highlight of the trip but to be honest a lifetime highlight as well!

We simply can't recommend the Taj Palace enough, it is a truly magical hotel providing a truly magical stay.
We had a fabulous time and look forward to our next visit, unfortunately next year
Stay was fantastic.
Brilliant!
nice
Delightful. It was a special treat , from  friends and lived up to the occasion.

We flew to Bombay with friends to stay at the Taj, after seeing the 3 part TV program in UK.
It was brilliant if you are in the Palace wing, definitely 6 star, but the Tower wing has miserable, small, cheaply furnished rooms, hardly 4 star.
F&B is very expensive. One wine, which they sell in their own shop, is 7 times the price in the restaurants.
Simply say, this hotel is 10 stars hotel. They know how to touch people's  heart regarding all aspects which guests expect from hotel while staying.
Everything was convenient in terms of hotel service, location.

Actually, this is the best Hotel in the downtown area of Mumbai. The world-class service and food are remarkable. But be aware if you are a light sleeper, you can hear some traffic and other guests in palace wing, depending on your room.
Opt for the garden view. :)
Stayed at the tower not the palace but the view of the Gate of India was great
perfect
Among the hotels that i have stayed so far ,this hotel is magnificient in its service from the rooms and its staff.i enjoyed the breakfast buffet its was fantasitic.
It was a lovely stay and got thoroughly spoilt. Will stay there again for sure if we ever happen to go to Mumbai again.

My husband and I came for three nights. We were impressed by this beautiful building and the rooms do not disappoint. The concept of service is taken to a new level here, with rose petals left in the room, extremely helpful staff, tours and staff falling over themselves to help you. For those worried about the water and traveller ailments associated with India, the taj has its own water purification facilities. Even the shower water is potable. Highly recommended. Just a note for first timers, there are two sections of the hotel - the tower which is new ,and the palace which is the regal, historical section.
Wonderful, would like to come back
Excellent stay. the recent renovations have made an amazing hotel even better. I will stay again on my next trip to Mumbai
Excellent stay. the recent renovations have made an amazing hotel even better. I will stay again on my next trip to Mumbai

we had a wonderful time at the Taj - it felt like being home. A family atmosphere, super friendly and helpful staff and a great ambiente. Just the right place to relax and enjoy a beautiful location and also to participate in a lively city. many major sites are in walking distance and you can choose one of the many boat trips right in front of your door step.
Perfect
Excellent.  Staff were great.  Hotel spa is exceptional

We had a wonderful experience on a whole but unfortunately the room that we had got was small in size. However, it's the quality that matters and it was really upto the mark. The luxurious lobby and the world class shopping experience is sufficient to pamper yourself.

Overall we had a fantastic stay, Mumbai was our last stop of our family trip to India, brilliant way to end a great holiday, Mumbai is one of the nicest, and the best places we visited in India..
The hotel was lovely we had 2 club rooms, in the Palace. My only complaint was that both at breakfast and during the cocktail hour we were kept waiting to enter before we could enjoy the facilities, however the timings were up held so if the cocktail hour was until 8 and you weren't able to enter the club room till late (due to lack of space) they would still stop serving at 8 which I though was a bit unfair, all guests should be accommodated accordingly, same with the breakfast, the sea lounge couldn't accommodate everyone at the busier times so you could be kept waiting outside for up to 20 mins, one of the mornings the buffet was being cleared away before we had even finished (the staff did let us know that this was about to happen but they had already started clearing it at the very same time so we didn't chance to enjoy breakfast properly) they did apologise after I complained. Again I didn't see it fair that after having had to wait (which I didn't mind) but then, that they would not then extend the timings accordingly allowing those guests to enjoy breakfast fully, they were very apologetic about this, I'm not sure if anyone else had complained about this but with all the attention to detail and high quality service I felt these were 2 areas (quite important though) do need looking, apart from this our stay was brilliant... my husband fell ill, they organised a doctor very quickly for us (who was very good).. oh and lastly I have to say how amazing the building tour guide was, unfortunately we cant remember the guys name, but he was fantastic!!So knowledgeable and entertaining!!
This is a lovely hotel, we could have stayed longer. We will be back same time next year.
It was meant to be a one off treat for me but having now stayed there I can never stay anywhere else if I go back to Mumbai. The little touches were just fabulous!
Like to stay longer and would come back immediately. Awesome hotel

Simply superb! You will not find another hotel that has this level of attention to detail, this refinement of staff, and efficiency of facilities. Situated in the heart of Colaba, this hotel is truly the crown jewel in the Taj Hotel group's offerings. Thank you for an amazing stay!

We stayed high up in the tower with fantastic views overlooking the Gateway to India. The room was very comfortable and well furnished. The hotel has so many shops and places to wander around or just relax. Our only negative is the Relatively high price of drinks at the bar.
A truly Taj Experience, Outstanding Hospitality. The hotel staff takes good care of their guests. Location is awesome in South Mumbai.
One of the most beautiful and comfortable hotel I have ever stayed. Everything was so good that I can easily say they can classify themselves as 7 star hotel.
Got free upgrade to palace wing again !! You guys are just awesome
Great
After the hustle and bustle. The Taj is a please you can relax.
Amazing

I couldn't have asked for a better first-time visit to Mumbai.  The Taj certainly lives up to its reputation as one of the best hotels in the world and my stay there made my trip to Mumbai even more special.  The warm care and service I received from the staff exceeded my expectations and I couldn't recommend this gem of a hotel more strongly.  I requested and was upgraded to a room in the palace section of the hotel which was utterly charming.  Should you ever have the opportunity to stay at this legendary hotel, do so.  It will be a very special experience.

Staffs were really nice and helpful.
Lobby was well-decorated.
But the room condition and breakfast were not superb as my expectation.
The hotel is a bit old, but the historically wealth for staying.

Great staff, friendly and helpful.
Fantastic ambience and a great history 
Very comfortable rooms and thoughtfully architected .
First class
The staff were very helpful; friendly and professional. The upgrade of our rooms was the cherry on the top. Will definitely stay there again on my next trip if the rates remain reasonable

A hotel with excellent location. The room was modern, had very good facilities and the staff were friendly and accommodating. The location of hotel is on main road with good access airport and Mumbai shopping area Choice of bars and restaurants within the hotel is excellent. The staff made the difference service with a smile.  Enjoyed the stay and will definitely return.

I couldn't resist such an iconic opportunity. My wife didn't know I booked the Taj, and when we pulled up at 1am her jaw dropped. We spent 3 magnificent days in the "old section" which had a great mix of traditional architecture and modern comfort. My wife commented everyday that this was the best hotel experience ever. The staff was constantly doting on us, the breakfast over-looking the water or the pool were equally wonderful. To come so far and not stay here would be a shame, even for budget travelers. Everyone should stay here at least once.
Very good experience. Seamless check in and check out. Prompt and adequate service.

We were upgraded from the city view to the view of India Gateway- THE BEST. We checked in really late at midnight and requested for late check out. Without a second thought, we were given a 4pm check out with no additional charge. The housekeeping service was superb  - sweet minor details everyday. I would stay again without a second thought.
Pleasant,comfortable,very friendly and efficient staff.
My stay was wonderful. Right from my arrival when I was greeted with a garland of flowers it was a great experience. After 3 days of travel it was an oasis of luxury and relaxation.
This was an excellent experience. Staying at the Taj is an experience you want to have again

Excellent. The staff was courteous and attentive. The room was comfortable and clean with a great view  Perhaps replace the shower curtains - a funny thing to see in a hotel of this standard. Your hotel is well located  - for me that is the most important aspect.

The Taj hotel in Mumbai is something different! Probalby the most awesome hotel I have ever been in from all the houndreds around the globe. It give u a true feeling of being a colonial king! Staff is amazing and helpful. They offer any kind of help you need. Got a bit of food poisoning when i stayed there but it could have come from something else too. location is good too, you can take the boat to elephanta island just outside the hotel. Be prepared for a crowded place!

We had a lovely stay at the Taj Mahal palace. The location is perfect, the pool and restaurant are really nice, the staff very helpful and competent. 
The food is abviously a bit pricey, but worth it considering the quality and the environment. 
We were upgraded and had a room with a view on the Gate of India. Just perfect!

It's my second time at this hotel , and the reason behind coming back to it is because of the great food that the hotel resturant provide as well as the building of the hotel it's very classical and amazing. Colaba Area is one of the famouse location of shopping in Mumbai that is the second reason. I am sure I am coming back again ..
Very, very good indeed. They have perfected hotel keeping into an art form all of their own.
I thorughly enjoyed my stay.  It was my first visit at The Taj Mahal Hotel.  I enjoyed teh elegance, the beauty, the style, the setting, the staff , the food. I can go on an on.
Totally amazing - looking forward to visting taj again very soon
Amazing

We loved staying here - from the moment we were picked up by the airport, we were treated with the utmost courtesy and thoughtfulness.  We are just ordinary travellers, who decided to treat ourselves to a special first three nights in India.  Nothing was too much trouble and we are very proud to have stayed at 'India's best hotel'!  A well deserved title.

Fantastic stay! We stayed in the palace wing for 3 nights. If you do so make sure not to mix the lounge room with free coffee and tea and the cognac and chocolate hour every night. Also the hotel history tour (every day at 5/6) is an absolute must and will give you so much appreciation for the hotel. The breakfast is phenomenal and I'm still trying to figure out the smell of the hotel. It feels like you're home - only better!
it was very nice stay

Having spent two nights at the Taj, our stay was nothing short of pleasant. We encountered many staff members who were extremely hospitable. Mr. Mistry at Wasabi, Mr. Bhushan at the Sea Lounge, Mr. Moshin and Mr. Sunil by the pool and Ms. Ayesna (sp?) at the reception were very gracious and welcoming. 

There are a few short comings that are worth a mention.

1) No Wi-Fi without paying extra. There is absolutely no excuse for this. In today's world that's like saying you have to pay for the use of electricity and water while you stay at the hotel. I have stayed at multiple hotels around the world and many 2 and 3 star hotels provide free wifi to their guests. It's not about the cost it just makes you feel less guest-like when you are asked to pay for it. 
2) I noticed a lack of attention to certain details. For example the wine bottle in the mini bar was priced at Rs. 1800 but there was a sticker in the back that said the retail price was Rs. 1200. That's just shoddy presentation.
3) Although friendly overall, I felt like the security staff at the front could do a little more to welcome guests. It is true that their job is very serious but sometimes a smile or a nod can go a long way. Maybe the hotel could have a greeter  just past the security guards at the entrance to make the guests feel more welcome? This is after all the first contact that a guest has with the hotel's staff. 

Overall we were very pleased with our stay. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to experience some of the best that Mumbai has to offer. The Taj Mahal Palace stands neck in neck with the top hotels of the world when it comes to hospitality.
Very good
My stay at Taj has been a lifetime experience. I was there to celebrate my birthday and the staff made sure that my special day turns out to be great. Thank you so much for the awesome hospitality.
Excellent stay.  Can't wait for my next get away to stay there!
Very nice

Fantasic. Taj is a fantastic hotel, in the best location. Dont be afraid to take a walk and visit all the cool design shops around the neighborhood like The Good Earth, Bungalow 8, and Bombay Electric. Lots of hecklers and beggars around (Unusual for rest of Mumbai), but I wouldnt worry about it. Politely decline and move on . Pool is nice. Great place to relax.
Excellent

One of my favourite hotel experiences! Staff were lovely, helpful, and went beyond to make my stay cushy and comfortable. I came back tired from work one day and the service staff had set up a complimentary foot soak and face mask for me to unwind with- it's these small touches that stood out to me most. Room was beautiful, felt quite plush, and very functional. This is a historical hotel with beautiful ornate furnishings and a fantastic view of the Gateway of India. Will definitely wish to return.
It was perfectly beautiful and comfotable stay as usual.

Taji Hotel is very famous in India.
I want to stay more. But Price is very high,
5+ stars! In everything they do at The Taj, it is simply the best! From doctors to postal service it was all there for us!! Well done Taj! We will be back soon!
Beautiful hotel in a great area of Mumbai.  Close to landmarks and good food and shopping.  Highly recommended and good value for money.
Execellent
Excellent throughout.
The hotel is fabulous and offers fantastic service and most of the big international shops in house, truly five star accommodation and friendly accommodating staff with the best food in Mumbai.

Service was awesome. Across the board. Spa, dining, concierge, staff, facilities. All excellent. Every single staff member, facility, view and service available is designed to be an experience you will not forget / talk about forever - and hold up as a benchmark for other hotels (that won't come close). This is the hotel that I want to bring my future partner/love back too... or if I need to impress business colleagues just as equally! You will not be disappointed. Upgrade to a water view, upgrade to a palace view.. all great.. if you can't - just experience the hotel in all in beauty - whatever room type - they will not treat you differently.... and remember to go outside... the Gateway of India is just outside your door!

Was here for a holiday, then needed to stay for business/work. Internet speed was AWESOME - not slow/no shaving/no limits! Staff were awesome. The attention to detail whether it was room service or laundry or concierge was brilliant. Airport transfers are of ease. I love this hotel - for what i paid per night the service was exceptional!

I've never ticker so many items in "great things about this hotel". The service is awesome (personalised). The staff are regular, attentive and knowledgable about you your interests, likes, issues - in a great way (not in a nosey way). The attention to detail and your experience - will make your stay amazing.! Take the tour!
Great stay, everything perfect. The only thing that could make it even better would be wifi included in room price.
amazing and wonderful place and i advise my friends to stay at Taj
Loved it. The room was plush, well equipped, beautiful bathroom. The building is stunning with so many beautiful feature. It is a proper palace.
Much better than expectation.
The staff was so attentive and as per my request the room was upgraded (as it was available) and was given sea view room.
Sensational. Thank you

the service and staff performance is excellent. they are very friendly and attentive with my needs/request. the buffet breakfast also very good with good variety of indian, international and chinese food. the hotel is not just beautiful, but the location also centrally located on tourist area with good restaurants and attraction just walking distance.

I was with my family to spend a short holiday on insistance of my younger daughter who wanted to celebrate her last year in India before she moves out. We were in two adjecent rooms but as soon the staff came to know about my daughter she was treated for 4 days really like little Princess. Taj is a presitigious hotel in India and is the ultimate luxury one can experience. The rich heritage, colorful history and it's location is superb. The restaurants in the hotel are competing with each other but the hotels nearby are no less. We loved being at Leopod and LPQ just walking distance. If you wish to soak yourself with high class luxury ever, never miss Taj at Mumbai Kolaba.

We stayed for 1 night and it was very great. I felt like a royal in my palace. :)
Security is very tight which is a good thing. I would definitely love to come back and stay here when I am in Mumbai.
It was nice to stay in the hotel. The staffs were friendly and accommodating. It have an easy access to the public transport and located at the heart of the city.

Truly one of the world's finest hotels, though you do pay for it.  Room in tower had spectacular view of harbor and Gateway of India.  Room wasn't as large or modern as similar hotels, but furnishing were top-notch and service was impeccable.  Dining was excellent -- be sure to enjoy afternoon tea in the Sea Lounge, lunch by the pool, and the signature drink in the Harbour Bar.  Don't waste your time with hotel tour, which was only an advertisement for hotel's shops and restaurants and light on the history.
wonderfull
A nice thing to do.
My stay at the Taj - as locals call it - was an unforgettable experience.

I was at Taj with my wife and Teenage daughter for vacation and we could not had it better. Right from the arrival till our stay we felt pampered. Taking care of our individual choices in breakfast and remembering  it for all four days of our stay touched us. My daughter was truly treated very special and was showered with every day surprise gift in her room including a cute bunny toy on day one (she is old enough for bunnies but she loved the attention). The daily morning tour of Hotel Taj is a memorable activity which must never be missed. You get to know very interesting historical facts about the hotel, Mumbai and Tatas (who built this hotel). Proximity to some wonderful restaurants in the vicinity is icing on the cake. The pool is fabulous and ever smiling staff is a treat to interact.
The rooms are not as big as you will find in some brand new luxury hotels but they are well kept, vintage look with all facilities. We were lucky enough to be booked into Palace part of the hotel (though we got the pool view as against sea view). If you are booking this for leisure be careful and check if your booked into Tower or the Palace. The tower (newly built part of the same hotel) is actually meant for business travelers.

I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. We were upgraded to a wonderful room in the palace wing with a fabulous view of the Gateway and sea. The evening tour of the hotel pointed out so many details we would have missed otherwise. There are beautiful flower arrangements throughout, very attentive and approachable staff. Attention to details made our stay above anything I have known before. Sunglasses left I the room would be joined by a glasses wipe. A book left on the table would have a bookmark left on it. Every time we returned to the room we were welcomed by such special touches. It was a privilege to stay here.

My stay at The Taj Mahal Palace was the single, best experience I have ever had in a hotel. I travel frequently to all sorts of places around the world, but my experience at The Taj Mahal Palace was phenomenal. I was delighted with the service, attitude and level of attention from the staff, and the property itself is purely majestic. To walk through the hotel is to feel like a king, and I would thoroughly recommend anyone to stay at this property as and when they have an opportunity. This is one of the last remaining places I have seen where you can experience the great tradition of Indian hospitality that has been such a feature for centuries in India. Great hotel, great staff, great stay.

Our 3 night stay at the Taj made our visit to Bombay one of the most enjoyable trips.Have been to Bombay various times but this was the first time at the Taj and would definitely stay at the Taj during our future visits.

i can say it simply fantastic....my wife birthday was on that day...they made my wife birthday very memorable one.by the time we checked inn and entered the room.it was decorated with flowers and balloons....and evening again surprised with a fantastic yummy cake...good place to stay with family and awesome swimming fool and wide variety of restaurants...had a really memorable moments
V.good and I enjoy my holiday with my family and it is my second time booking in taj.
Very comfortable, we enjoyed...Food , Services, Staff, View...everything was 100%

Great stay!  Amazing hotel that will truly give you a luxury Mumbai experience.  Service, room, breakfast all 5 star.  Only complaint - free wifi only in business centre and only for 30 mins - cheesy for this calibre of hotel.
its very comfortable ..value of money..love to visit again my family was happy specially my 6yr old son loved it
very nice hotel. Although its a business hotel but we used it for leisure travel and the hotel format is such that it was very enjoyable for us.
THE STAY WAS EXCELLENT,BUT DISAPPIONTED THERE WAS NOT FREE WI-FI

rooms were good and comfortable with  good in house restaurants. however was surprised to see that they wer3 charging for internet service in the room.  Also would have been good if there was WC shower fitted.
Very comfortable and relaxing stay, Staff sere friendly and helpful.  Hotel of this grade and charges for internet service is very surprising.

It was nice and relaxing stay.  Staff were very supportive and friendly.  However I was surprised to see that wireless internet was not free and there was no WC shower.  These facilities are now available in almost all hotels.
Great stay - the service was second to none. Everything worked very efficiently. We got upgraded to the old palace wing which really made or stay great. The breakfast was delicious!

We loved this hotel. It is of the highest quality and represents good value for money despite the higher rates.
Food is available in a range of restaurants and a range of menus.
The pool feels like a tropical island with palm trees around a large pool.
We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Mumbai. It was great.
Superbe location, historic beauty to admire, lovely ambience, nice staff and good food.

This was our encore visit to The Taj Mahal Palace Hotel!  
We commenced our most recent visit to India in Mumbai at the Taj Palace - We also ended our trip at The Taj Palace Mumbai!
Thank You!
We shall return sooner rather later - for sure!

The Best Hotel we have ever stayed at!
Luxurious Decor!
Truly Pampered by The Palace Team!
Topped by the Decadent Food!
We will be back very soon!

Stay was great. After spending a few weeks in cheap guesthouses it was a nice change for a few nights. Comfy bed, hot shower, in room safe and across the road from the Gateway of India. Good cheap food not far away and top notch security.

Lovely Indian service, warm welcome (with flowers) and a drink.  Stayed in the Palace Wing (highly recommend as this section has been renovated) with a room overlooking the Gateway to India.  Wonderful service, attention to detail in the room (from thoughtful small gifts to the staff inserting a Taj Palace bookmark in my book where they saw I had turned down a page corner).  Rooms and baths are well appointed and the property is beautifully maintained, clean and comfortable.  Beds were perfect.  I can't say a negative thing about this property.

I enjoyed my stay at Taj Mahal hotel
The service was very good
The staff was very welcoming and nice
Clean Room clean bathroom as well 
The room service was fast and The food was Delicious.

The only two things i didn't love about the hotel was the 3G conection was so bad , and the maids was asking too much about the Cleaning and if im ok with their cleaning !
Whats so annoying about it that they ask more than 3/2 times A DAY
They even call from the reception if you tried to ignore a little but just to ask you if everything was ok 
Personally i dont like to keep answering the door or the phone more than once when i try to Relax 
Specially when its about the same question !
We have stayed at the Palace section before and we got much better service there than staying at the a tower section. Breakfast and the service at breakfast was not very good.

My stay in the hotel gave mix feelings, while the service was nothing to complaint, the food was amazing in Japanese and Indian restaurants even the bakery. The tea served here was also great. But there are some problem of sound proof, I stay on 6th floor but still can hear car horn sound from the city below, which sometime so loud that disturb my sleeping, quite dissapointing on this matter.

I travel extensively for work and pleasure, and I can safely say that this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff literally bend over backwards to accommodate any request, and the building itself has a beautiful and fascinating history. Ask for a sea view room overlooking India Gate - worth the premium price.
The stay was very pleasant.  We will stay again at the Taj when we visit Mumbai in future.

Recommend because of history and location.  Concierge most helpful.  Atmosphere cold with no welcoming touches in room.  Not happy to be given a smoking room and staff made little effort to relocate us.

We had originally booked in the tower section of the hotel. The rooms were average, nothing great. We requested to be moved to The Palace. Despite the increased charge, the upgrade was amazing. The rooms were large, beautiful and extremely clean. The attention to detail could be seen in the smallest things. The service was unbelievable with cleaning staff leaving beautiful messages on our pillows, placing bookmarks in our books and going extra lengths to make our stay comfortable.

We spent a month in India at less expensive hotels but for the one night we stayed here we were treated like royalty (despite clearly not being!) and enjoyed the luxury. Breakfast was included, a buffet of international range and quite easily one of the best we've ever had anywhere! Everything else at taj is extra tho (e.g. WiFi was 700 rupee/hr) and bar prices matched london.

It was not worth the money, not in the chaos of Xmas, like stepping into a shopping mall full of tourists when alighting the lift. No internet room is crazy in this level of luxury. Food very ordinary...2restaurants booked out could only have Xmas lunch round the pool!
nice quiet surroundings, in room router for wifi although you pay for internet, staff very helpful, great buffet breakfast. wouldn't change much.

My stay here was far too short!  I was in Mumbai for business and really didn't get to see much of the city.  The best part of my stay was the view from the room.  I looked out onto Gateway to India and it was so beautiful to see at sunrise!  The weather in Mumbai was amazing.  Warm, sunny, not too cold at night.  People were out on the streets until midnight, just enjoying the weather.  The breakfast was quite good and I enjoyed eating out by the pool area.  The wifi is great in the hotel and can be accessed from all areas of the hotel.  Unfortunately, they do charge about US$20/day for wifi.  Would be better if it were free! I would stay here again.

One of best hotel in Asia. value for moeny compared to other heritage hotels.
Breakfast varaiation
GREAT EXPERIENCE.....!!  UNPARALLEL SERVICE STANDARDS, CUSTOMISED SERVICE, TREAT YOU LIKE A KING...QUALITY FOOD, FLEXIBLE CHECKIN / CHECK OUT, HIGH SPEED INTERNET,

Truly first class
A little too busy the front and lobby, give the recent past experience but safety of the hotelier taken care off...
Very glad I stayed here

Absolutely amazing hotel!
Best trained staff in the world!
The hotel made you want to stay longer and longer as the staff truly make you feel so special!
Gorgeous on both sides - the heritage club side and the lesser expensive tower side - stayed in both !
The only thing I didn't like is that thei wifi is charged extra - which for such a high end hotel should be complimentary and that it kicks you off the network and you have to constantly log in again- which is a royal pain..
goood but not recommended for Arabs people because non of the 80 channels in the hotel TV is Arabic, so Arabs will feel bored in the rooms
It has good location to visit and has history hotel. Service in the hotel is very good and make me feel comfortable. It deserved to visit again.

Fabulous stay with great service from all in the hotel! The only tiny complaint I have will be the tiny shower cap that could not fit any adult! 
Great restaurants by foot include Indigo, Leopold and the hotel Italian and Chinese restaurants!

We had a great stay at the Taj. From the moment we entered, we were treated like royalty. From being garlanded and given some tea in reception to giving us a complimentary gift for staying with them. It truly is a beautiful hotel, very opulent. the breakfast is sooo good, very big variety. This is the hotel to stay in Mumbai.
Excellent stay, the staff are fantastic. Booking ongoing flights, advice on tours and attraction. Business application etc.  I can't fault anything about this hotel.
Cannot be faulted. Excellent on all levels. Golden dragon resturant is amazing.

We initially booked for the Basic superior room located in the Tower wing. Although they upgraded us to a Deluxe room in the Tower wing facing the Arabian Sea we were still very disappointed at the room size, ceiling height, bathroom size and the general atmosphere within. It was by no way 5 star standards given the high price we booked at. We called the reception and complained. They offered to show us rooms in the Palace Wing. Believe me when I say this, one was heaven and the other was hell. Significant difference and much to our liking. Unfortunately we had to pay extra which blew up our budget for the trip but I think it was worth it. They did upgrade us to the Taj Club which had more facilities and privileges attached. If anyone is traveling to Taj Mahal, you need to book in the Palace Wing. Otherwise choose some other 5 star hotels. Overall the staff were friendly and attentive. And they gave us a lot of pleasant surprises in our room every night. Very personal touch. As we were celebrating our 3rd year wedding anniversary they gave us a nice cake on arrival. Great service and personal attention to detail! Housekeeping did a fantastic job and making the room feel welcoming every time we step foot in it away from the hustle and bustle of Mumbai life. Enjoyed the high tea, evening cocktails and 'chocolate n cognac'  which were a treat available free for Taj Club patrons.

I stayed at the Tower. You have a heritage wing of the hotel with Suites which looks luxurious but I cannot comment on that.
The Tower rooms were not very impressive. The decor looks dated and the room had an aged look to it. The food was nothing great with not a very big spread on breakfast. I have been at better business hotels in Mumbai.
Fabulous. And extraordinary after service, when I left some belongings there that were forwarded to me.

It will be SHOCKED while you come into this FANTASTIC hotel in the 1st time, that is a very dreamful exp as you comes into a Bollywood Scene. STRONGLLY recommand this hotel as your 1st stay in Mumbai. you will feel that you are in the heart of this amazing city.
every thing was great I will tell every one to go this hotel via agoda

First time stay in Taj mumbai, i had a quality stay, the best hospitality by their friendly staff, tasted the best indian cuisine.
Highly recommended for leaser and business travelers.
SUBERP STAY WITH HISTORICAL ADVENTURE , AND MARVELLOUS PLACE TO STAY
HISTORIC STAY WITH FANTASTIC ACCOMODATION AND GREAT STAY WITH
Pool was really good. I wanna stay this hotel again.

the Taj Mahal Palace is an institution and a proud part of Indian history. Of course this comes at a price. The tower rooms are as good as any other hotel of its category, but the position and the view - right opposite the gateway to India - and the elegance of the old part of the hotel give it an extra edge. You stay here for the experience as much as the facilities - and it is an experience!
Very comfortable stay in Old Wing room; beautiful ornate rooms; lovely pool setting; exemplary attentive, courteous and friendly service; undoubtedly one of Indias finest hotels.
Was there for a weekend trip. Really enjoyed our stay. It was my mom's b'day and the staff of Taj made the day very special for her!!! It is the best of all the Taj hotels that we have stayed in!!

ABSOLUTELY AWESOME. My friend and i are budget travellers, when we were going through Lonely Planet - India, we saw that this hotel was 'splurgeable'. 75% of our travel budget went to this hotel, but no regrets. WELL WORTH IT!

What should i say... it is an extraordinary place to stay. We could afford only one night in the Taj buj it was worth it. We had the best breakfast of all hotels so far. The inner garden with the large swimming pool realy takes you back in history due to its apperence.

Great Hotel with a lot of History
Best experience. great hotel and service was excellent

I have extanted my stay from 19 to 28 and then from 29 to 4 July
Very happy if I go back I will only stay same hotel taj
My stay at the hotel was excellent.  I will definely come back

We travelled around India for nearly four months and this was our last stop off point before flying home.  From the effortless welcome, the rooms to checking out, it was superb - the best of the best.
just the best

I happened to be a guest on my birthday. They had my whole room flooded with red heart shaped baloons, bed was decorated, a bouquet of flowers and a large chocolate cake. This was a real treat for someone travelling on business on birthday, away from family.
Only downside to this hotel is you had to pay  for wifi which in my experience comes  free in most hotels .Wifi is also very expensive.

In a nutshell.....well worth it.....right accross from the Gateway of India, the hotel itself is a Heritage Site, no security concerns after the last attack, great and professional staff, clean rooms and a range of cuisine to choose from......

Fantastic hotel, room was large and extremly well furnished. The staff were polite and attentive. he facilities were in th hotel were very good business centre and the pool and gym facilites were very good. Internet charges were quite high for hotel of this stature and should have included in the charges for the room. definatley stay again
The hotel is great and is in the city , good ocean view and one of the famous sightseeing spot.
Nice stay love the hotel

The purpose of my visit was mainly shopping. 
I requested a double bed room, but was given a room with two single beds.  I requested a change an immediate change which I got. I was glad that I opted for a room with a double bed as it was slightly larger and more spacious.  The room was comfortable and clean, but not as luxurious as I had expected. The bed was rather uncomfortable - I expected a plush, soft mattress.  I have stayed in the Leela Kempinski near the airport a few times and in comparison, their rooms are a lot more luxurious and the beds are extremely comfortable.
The location of this hotel was excellent for my purpose of visit - shopping.  It was not too far a distance from the areas that I wanted to visit.  
The breakfast was decent.  Not an extensive variety but enough choices.  The staff at the restaurant were extremely attentive without being intrusive.  However, breakfast on Saturday was not a good experience at all - I requested for hash browns to go with my scrambled eggs which didn't arrive.  When I inquired I was told it had been forgotten!  When it finally did arrive it was under cooked; not the nice golden colour one would expect.  By this time I was fed up and was and had long finished my scrambled eggs.  however, the supervisor insisted on getting the perfectly golden hash browns, which i finally got!  my request for waffles was also forgotten - they weren't good anyway.
Pastries and cakes - not good.
Good variety of fruits. Dosa was delicious.  Highlight was the fresh honey with honeycomb - loved that!
All in all a  pleasant stay.  As this was my first stay in Taj group of hotels I was expecting a little more luxury!

At a hotel like this I would expect free wifi. There are lots of taxis near the front of the hotel or you can arrange transport through the hotel. Great view of India Gate and and a great overall experience.

Staying at the Taj Mahal Palace was truly the most superb hotel experience I have ever had, and probably ever likely to have. The staff could not have been more attentive, but were never over-bearing. The pool and breakfast room were gorgeous, and I had the best night sleep I'd had in months. If you're travelling to Mumbai, the Taj Mahal is a must!
Great for a night, but not sure worth the money for an extended stay.

When i arrived we were welcome by a welcome flower. The staff there is very helpful and they even escort you to the room and show you the surroundings. In the hotel you are surrounding with the aroma oil and it smells great! The staff is very helpful, they help us to become the translator when we call upon a taxi. It's a good stay and you will feel the different India especially when you look out from the room window. The gateway of India just in front of you! It looked beautiful when sunrise and sunset!

This luxery hotel was surely that.  The staff could not do enough for you, running back to add breakfast items, negotiating taxi service, or simply saying hello with a smilt.  The Taj is a great place, after a site seeing blitz, to take some time off.  Try the high tea in the Sea Lounge you will not be disappointed.  The only weak point is paying for internet access, that needs to change.
Stands up to its reputation as an excellent hotel.Those who are in doubt, try a breakfast around the pool area.

An oasis in the middle of chaos.  The Taj Mahal Palace is so iconic of India.  We live in India and staying here was just something we needed to do.  While staying in the new tower isn't as exciting as the classic part of the hotel, it is a great deal on the weekends.  You still get access to the beautiful pool and fantastic restaurants.  Service is top-notch.  Oh, and be sure to check out high tea.  It's amazing and you won't need much for dinner after that.  Get there early to get a booth on the window to look out at the water and India Gate.  You'll feel like the king and queen of the town watching the world go by.

It was a great place. Location superb as it is near the beach and also near the shopping centres. Service was also good. Over all this hotel is good. The business centre also good. The staff are friendly.
Everything from the rooms to the staff to the breakfast, the gym, the swimmingpool is completely amazing! I have never been to a more positive and great hotel! Wow!

Highly professional yet friendly service by very personable staff make the "Taj experience" all that one hopes for in a legendary hotel.  The details that combine to make this a smooth, pleasant experience include courtesy, clear communication, under-lights in bathroom for easy access in the dark, quality towels and toiletries, quiet, fast elevators and carpeted corridors.
Bed linen was crisp yet dreamy soft, the good desk had a view of the Arabian Sea.

originally booked a tower room, but upon arrival we were given an upgrade to the palace wing. room was amazing: marble bathroom, comfortable bed with many pillow options, beautiful and calming decor. it was a total paradise and welcome escape from the overwhelming atmosphere that one can be confronted with in india. buffet breakfast was nice. you can also get beef at the restaurants... so spaghetti bolognese was a welcome luxury after 2 weeks of classic indian food.
We stayed in the club rooms in the old part of the hotel. Hotel is absolutely beautiful. Pool area was great to relax. Service was impeccable and the location was great, in the best area of Mumbai.
End of a hard month of traveling perfect end of the stay. Worth every penny

it is one of the horrible hotel  of taj brand in india...stinking actors the hotel due to horse , non maintained room with half of amenities not working, uncleared floors...
most importantly very poor internet services.. rude and arrogant behavior of restaurant during breakfast and dinner.. and very ordinary quality of food....

overall, waste of money to stay with taj mahal hotel, 

people stay because of its location

this will be my only choice to stay for all my future trips to mumbai. the service is fantastic, the standards exceptionally high and the food excellent. this is a must experience for all who can or who can not (like us) afford it.
a very pleasant stay. however, room did not have a view worh mentioning

The Taj Mahal Palace offered very good personel service. The room service is perfect, at times a bit slow. The restaurant services are excellent. The morning breakfast buffet is a wonderful combination of Indian and Western Continental style food.
The tropical garden near the pool is nice. At times the black crows try to pick on the food if your not awear.
it was so awesome being part of one of india's oldest heritage with excellent class service n hospitality

Loved everything about this place.  Impeccable service, beautiful setting, lovely hotel, amazing water feature tribute to those who lost their lives in the terrorist attack, great security, wonderful food,they don't miss a thing, making your stay a pleasure.

The building and rooms are beautiful, like a Palace. Thus the place needs to be renovated. No modern shower, only a bath tub with a shower. The pool area is very loud. The food in the Pool side restaurant poor. The breakfast is a threat for your figure, you get everything you like - they offer a huge variety. The Spa is nice, I had a great massage. Gym is ok, friendly personal trainers are available.
Service is great!

Our view  from the tower over the Gate to India spectacular.
The pillows
Breakfast near the pool

just a perfect place to be
experience the 'old wing' part to embrace this hotel and part of Mumbai's history

I came down with a terrible stomach bug my first day in Mumbai and the hotel not only looked after my physical health with a superb doctor and immediate delivery of necessary medicine, they also lifted my spirits with small gestures of kindness.  At every instance the staff showed genuine concern that my stay be as pleasant as possible which was especially notable 
as I was confined, due to illness, to the hotel for an entire week.  I can not say enough wonderful things about the depth of dedication to their guests each and every member of the staff projects.   This is the ultimate in 5 star service with a genuine smile.  Thank you to all the gracious people who took such good care of me and to the owners who are clearly dedicated to making the experience of each guest a complete delight.

The hotel is amazing comparing to your other generic 5 star hotels.  They offered us a late check out until 3 or a half day rate until 9 pm if you those late flight.  The pool, sauna, steam room and gym were also free to use.  The location is perfect as you can see the gate way to india from your room and walk to the boat the elephant island.  The only gripe is you have to pay for Wifi but thats pretty much the same for other in class.

we absolutely loved every minute of our stay at the taj.  all the workers were incredibly helpful and pleasant, especially roop who did the hotel tour and glen at the concierge desk.  everyone did their absolute best to accommodate you and make sure you had a pleasant stay.  we originally had booked a tower room (we didn't realize at the time of booking), when we had shown up to check in they gave us a free upgrade.  this kind of thing never happens to my wife and i, so we were perplexed, but incredibly excited.  needless to say, i recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again in the future.

since it was not the first time that i was a guest in the taj mahal hotel mumbai, i new, what i am going to expect. it is so far the best hotel i have visited ever. ther is realy nothing to complain. the only thing maybe is, that the spa area should get renovated.

We stayed in the tower and had great views over the Gateway, people to one side and the boats to the other. The service was exceptional. The room was okay, nothing fantastic. I'd expect more for just shy of 200GBP. Dinner at the Masala Kraft restaurant was nice, but overpriced. The swimming pool and spa are lovely.

This is the first hotel we've ever stayed in where the hotel experience was the highlight of the whole of our time in a city - Mumbai is hard work, but the Taj makes it very bearable. From the moment that reception uttered those words that every travellor hopes for, "we have upgraded you sir", we felt like kings. The ambience of the Palace wing (completely refurbished after the 2008 terrorist attack), the exemplary service, the complimentary cocktails and the cognac and chocolate nightcap made the stay here a highlight of 5 weeks in India. Splurge if you can - it's worth every penny.

made my 2 year infant feel so special 
great welcome
breakfast spead disappointed

Stayed in Nov 2012 - King Room Superior w/ Sea View

* Incredible vista of waterfront and Gateway
* Amazing hospitality from check-in staff at arrival (great ideas like flight check-in)
* Nice pool.
* Free guided walks of hotel and area (very interesting).
* Great breakfast. Wasabi restaurant can be missed - terrible value for money and you would expect better service/decor/quality.
we always love staying at the taj - all things considered best hotel in mumbai.

This is a wonderful hotel.
The staff are well informed and friendly and will help with anything you may want.
The pool is beautiful, the rooms large and clean and the location is very good.
A beautiful hotel with delightful staff. Fantastic stay and would definitely come back.

I transferred to the Raj hotel from another 5 star Mumbai hotel following a recommendation from one of my suppliers.

Probably the best decision of my trip to Mumbai.

The one and only criticism I have is that the bathrooms in the Tower rooms are somewhat dated and lack a separate shower.

Very efficient staff who do everything possible to make their guests comfortable.

Being extremely critical the only negative point is that the rooms  in the Tower Wing are quite small for a hotel of this calibre and, space permitting, it would be good to have a separate shower cubicle.
Definitely lived up to the famous hotel that it is, stunning location overlooking the gate of India, you will not be disappointed by staying here, we loved every minute of our stay.

i stayed here with my baby daughter and staff were very helpful and friendly to make it a comfortable stay. 
the restaurants are beautiful and its a pleasure to wander the hallways and lobby. many galleries and restaurants close by to keep you busy. i recommend the high-tea at sea view lounge for a relaxiing afternoon.
I stayed for a night and had a great time there. Services were excellent, staffs were very nice, room was spacious. Everything was very good. Would like to come back next time. Thanks a lot, Taj!

This is the best hotel we have ever stayed at anywhere in the World. Words cannot describe the opulence,charm and depth of this incredible establishment. It is very clear that absolute passion is what drives every single employee here, many of which have worked here for 15 years or more. The service and room and hotel appointments in general are astonishing. It's eye opening and breattaking from the minute you enter the building. What can I say....take me there again now!

Upon arrival we received an upgrade to the Palace section & were guided to that reception area. Check-in was done in a second without the usual delays & filling out forms & the bags brought up instantly. We were welcomed in the traditional manner. 

The hotel is an oasis of quiet luxury in the hot & noisy maelstrom that is Bombay.

This was by far the best hotel that we have ever stayed at. THe service was outstandig and the attention to detail was really amazing. On our first morning, when the newspaper was delivered to the room, the front page of the Syndey MOrning Herald was also delivered (to keep us in touch with news back home). Concierge services were excellent- nothing was too hard, or to difficult! Shops in the lobby were great as well. THe view from the room was perfect and the bed was so comfortable, but the breakfast in the Sea Lounge was the best part- the best tea I have ever had with the absolute best service!

we chose to stay in this hotel because:
- my indian friends said it's the hotel in mumbai
- it was featured in mi4 (note that the movie only showcased the ballroom and the suite floor... when u stay in this hotel, will u be going to the ballroom or the suite floor?)

why i won't stay in this hotel again:
- the staff is always hungry for tips. i'm not sure if it's because tom cruise tipped all the staff $ bills each or it's just the general attitude in mumbai... my friend and i was carrying 2 small luggage, a staff offered to bring them up to our room and we didn't have small change to tip him so we smiled "thank you." he just stayed there waiting... staring at us with an odd grin. we said "thank you" again but he dind't leave. so we ended up giving him $5-> my indian friend said a tip of $1-2 is the norm for hotel staff... and this happened again to us when we were leaving the hotel. 
- the front desk is unfriendly and a little unprofessional. we requested for room on higher floor, quieter, facing the ocean. she didn't even tell us what room she gave us and smiled "here's you key, your room is ready." when we went up we realized, she gave us room on 4th floor, facing the main town, which is full of honking noise until 1am... we were too tired to argue as we checkin in at 1030pm.

why we might return to this hotel:
- best location in mumbai... unless there'll be a new hotel built in the area soon! i hope this happens! plenty of amazing restaurants walkable from the hotel... and it's relatively safe because there is a college nearby~

i spent a couple of days in the taj mahal palace. it was excellent. if you would like to be treated as a real guest, spend some nights in this hotel. you will enjoy everything, from the rooms, the breakfast, the pool and the luxury stores and service!

A beautiful hotel which takes you back to feeling like you are living in the 1920's. The highlights were the breakfast and the hightea. Situated in a perfect position for endless shopping with markets and brand stores stretched all around the area. Will definitely stay again if I'm ever back in Mumbai. The buffet breakfast was Plentiful and great quality.
Absolutely beautiful hotel - we were upgraded as we were on our honeymoon and our room was absolutely beautiful

I stayed here just two days,  but it was an unforgettable experience.   The hotel staff are extremely helpful and always trying to address the needs of the customer. 

I had a room overlooking the India Gate which was a rewarding experience.   

The hotel also several wonderful restaurants including international,  Indian, and Chinese cuisines.   All of them were magnificent.  

The Spa was best I have ever experienced in India.

Stunning grand hotel in the heart of the Colaba area, within 5 minuntes walking distance to great shopping and eating district. Best breakfast, with 5 star service.

Rooms in the tower building felt a little dated and in need of an upgrade.

Overall experience was fantastic and highly reccommened for couples, or even families with young children.

checked in here for three nights after a horrid stay at the midland hotel.  
it has a provenance that makes it dear to the indian people and others around the 
world.    speaking to other guests, it was a reason they also chose this hotel.
the breakfast is delicious and you can have it around the pool which is beautiful and heated.
the room was very comfortable with a step out balcony.  make sure you take the free
five o'clock evening tour.

After a couple of months of travelling in India staying at places from we decided to stay at the Taj. The guidebooks seemed to be down on Mumbai and hotels at about and below had very mixed reviews...it was my wife's birthday too so we decided to splurge. It was wonderful: spotless, comfortable, and gracious staff -- even to a couple of old hippies who had been washing their clothes in hotel sinks for weeks.

Our stay here was excellent from start to finish.  We were treated like royalty, enjoyed the absolute most comfortable bed in a beautiful room with a stunning view, swam in a gorgeous pool, and ate delicious food at the restaurant.  The location of the hotel couldn't be better, allowing us to walk to interesting shops, sights, and restaurants.  Our questions were answered promptly and with attention to detail.  I haven't a single negative point about this hotel.  Worth every penny!
there was a problem with our hotel driver and we have ended up waiting over an hour at an empty airport (late night) before someone finally turned up.
There is nothing they wouldn't do for you. My girlfriend lost her book. they could find it They just went out and bought her a new one.
Amazed by the excellent service of the hotel staff, excellent location.

Although its the Taj Mahal, there is a difference between being a guest in the 'Palace' and the 'Towers'.... Its supposed to be international standard, but its a bit grubby. The staff are good, friendly and efficient.

NB This review is for VIVANTA By TAJ MALABAAR

Check in procedure is prompt and relaxed, individual attention seated within the lobby area.
The rooms had sea views and are clean with everything you need. Bathrooms had great electronic blinds!
There are various activities -  there is a boat trip every day at 5pm to see great sunsets by chinese fishing nets, traditional indian dance and great ayurvedic spa treatments.
The staff go out of their way to help.
As with most Indian hotels the wine is really expensive and Indian wine not always very good. Sula is the best if you want to try it.

upon arrival service was second to none. offered incredibly early check-in and very late check out. checked things like air miles cards to ensure i could claim points. 
upgraded to superior room, although i must admit a real disapointment. stayed in the tower rooms, the room was standard 5 star affair and not something to remember, no seperate shower - very small space. felt old and certainly will consider paying a lot more for the palace rooms. outside the room the hotel was an incredible experience. excellent service throughout, the pool area was beautiful and peaceful. breakfast was ok. looking forward to taking a palace room next time.

we had some initial trepidation about staying at the taj mahal palace after the incident in 2008.  however, the charm of the place and the fantastic service at all levels of the hotel just won us over the moment we checked in.  there are also abundant f&b choices in and around the hotel.  being sited next to the historical gateway to india puts us close to the hustle abd bustle of the city but yet we are safely ensconced in the peace and quiet of the hotel.
we enjoyed our stay very much at this grand hotel. early check-in and late check and we made the most out of our time here, including a dip in the pool.

i am myself the owner of a luxury small hotel and i must admit that travelling around the world in many palaces , i never had such a luxury experience

out of the fact that this historical hotel himself and the location , the service and the kindness and efficiency of the staff is a lesson to take for any person working in this industry.

close to perfection 

i will return and will keep the best remember of this experience in such a beautiful palace

This building stands out in Apollo Bandar, a massive palace on the waterfront. The service was exceptional except for one very annoying point: when I checked in for my two night stay, I asked to have a late check out on the last day. The concierge said somebody would call me about it. No call the first day. The second day I rang the front desk and asked again. They said I'd get a call, again no call. The day of my checkout I called to ask, they said they'd get back to me. They rang back - half an hour before check out time, to say it would not be possible! Very inconvenient that they did not let me know earlier. Other than that, great place to stay!

Wait, one more thing - the mediterranean rooftop restaurant is terrible. Vastly overpriced and average food - although I had just been in Beirut... try some of the restaurants in the apollo bandar area instead, many great ones to choose from
everything totally 5 star, up to snuff; nothing lacking, usa/european prices...everything. an experience of the old raj india, not the current india...but a unique out of the past stay.

housed in a 1903 building with a modern tower extension, our room was a mix of old-world charm andv indian elegance. the public areas reflect moorish, oriental, indian and florentine influences with vaulted ceilings, hand-woven carpets and crystal chandeliers.

there's a pool and fantastic spa and if you stay in one of the suites you get breakfast, happy hour cocktails and a bed time brandy for free.
¬†
the x-factor is that there are eight restaurants serving a wide range of cuisines, including eastern mediterranean at the rooftop souk and japanese at wasabi by morimoto.

i just regret being so shortly in the hotel. the view from the rooms over the bay is wonderful. personal very friendly and helpful all the time. by the price of a breakfast you can eat a wonderful dinner at the restaurants surrounding the hotel.

we were upgraded to the palace tower. the hotel had so much character and so rich in culture with the art pieces generously displayed along the hallways. it is really living in a palace! 
check in was done by the duty manager while we waited in a private lounge.
the lobby of the tower was exclusive and had a beautiful fresh flower arrangement. 
a lifetiime experience!

Staff treated us like Royality and were extremely helpful and caring. My wife was sick for the evening and we ordered room service. The waiter went beyond the call of duty and made herbal medicine to cure her cold. The restuarant staff and breakfast staff guided us in the selection of the cuisines we wished to eat which we thoroughly enjoyed. The porters and travel desk were very helpful and the hotel even discounted some of the items on my bill, to my surprise. Excellent choice to stay at the hotel to experience the Taj Royalty, I will most definitely go back to the Taj














l
a great hotel with lots of past history.service at its best.

this is a world class hotel and everything lives up to that standard. when things went wrong (our new year's car was ordered for 2013 not 2012) they compensated us immediately and went out of their way to make our stay even more memorable.

all the food they served was 1st class and the service knowleagable and attentive
Taj mahal is one of finest and oldes hotel in mumbai it before freedom

Arrived very early, but our rooms were available. Not only that, the hotel upgraded us to their Palace Rooms. Which included free drinks at certain times. We were so well looked after by the ever present and helpful staff. A weekend to remember. Would highly recommend for any special occasion.

i was only able to stay for one night but i was very impressed by  the service. i enjoyed the use of the spa and the pool as well as the bar and restaurant areas. every member of staff was welcoming and helpful. a fantastic stay

we had stayed at the taj mahal palace for 3 nights and was well worth every penny spent. it was a wonderful experience and we have not one flawed memory of the entire stay there. from the onset of our interaction with staff they were always pleasant and attentive. the attention to detail and service were impeccable. the decor is luxurious and tasteful. it was the perfect place to end our holiday in india.

this historic place is just a great place to stay. it is centrally located and you get the comfort you expect im india for a 5 star hotel. it is important to know that the palace and the tower is connected and room categories are different. the palace, as the name suggests, is better to stay with. the rooms in the tower are good, and with carpet rather a bit smelly. nevertheless the common area is shared and is just a gorgeous fairy-tale blend of islamic and renaissance styles.

whether you are passing through or staying a while, this is a great hotel. if you go to mumbai and have not visited the taj tower and palace, you have short changed yourself.
you have a choice; the tower is cheaper and the palace is superb, but both worth staying at.
This time we stay in the tower side, but actualy the palace side should be the heritage part, thats a little bit not in our expectation. but the room is great and serveice as well.

the superior rooms in the tower section are very value. you have access to almost all of the same top quality facilities as those staying in the palace. the gateway of india and colaba causeway is just outside. if you like shopping close at hand, this is ideal, plus loads of excellent restaurants.

The rooms are very large, clean and well-equipped.  The high ceilings are very nice.  The bathtub is also one of the larger ones I've seen.  Although the building has never been a 'palace', you can imagine exactly how living in one would be like.  

The service is also remarkable.  The service staff seem genuinely eager to help you with any and all request, none to small.  They even offered to help my pack my bags the night before i checked out! The pride within each employee of the Taj is very obvious and this comes shining through with their impeccable service.

The Taj Hotel is a very nice hotel however the rooms are starting to become quite dated and very old style looking a bit tired. The internet was a good connection however they charge per device unlike most other hotels. The restaraunts were very expensive and food quality was not that great. bar food was particularly expensive as was the simple buffet despite much better offerings for lower prices at other Indian hotels. Car hire was also very expensive compared to other hotels. TV was very old and did not work properly despite asking for it to be fixed.

Pleasant.  Room with nice view. Staff very eager to please and helpful.  Nicely decorated public areas.  Breakfast very nice and pleasant atmosphere all round. Location good for downtown (MG road etc.)

Pros:
- Courteous and helpful staff
- Great restaurants (try Wasabi!)
- High security
- Beautiful hotel surroundings (the pool area is a nice place to sit back and relax)
- Excellent breakfast

Cons:
- Was really disappointed with the television in the room. It looked like it was from the 1980s! I had been travelling in India for three weeks and had stayed in some hotels that cost a third of what the Taj Tower Wing cost and they had bigger flat screen televisions! Time for an upgrade Tata!

Excellent hotel with really great service.
Heritage palace wing with beautiful interiors.
Rooms all new but a but small for what you expect.

Complete mess at the hotel entrance.  No parking facilities. Rooms out dated, need renovation. Prices totaly over standart. Who is not on buisseness in Mumbai should avoid going to this city. Never again.
nice hotel, very helpful staff, good value for money, I would recomment it and stay there again, perfect as a departure point for a mumbai sightseeing tour.

Our family spent several days to celebrate a special occasion and were overwhelmed by special attention to detail to make our stay memorable - welcome surprises at every turn: wine, flowers, rose petals decorating our bed, cakes, cards and small gifts from staff.  Excellent breakfast buffet and high tea.
Superb as always. The more we stay hwere, the more we like it. So many excellent shops just around the corner.
What more can you say. It lives up to its 5 star rating.

Exclusive hotel and Nice place
Very comfortable hotel for business and holidays travel,
The hotel car for pick up us very good.

Wonderful 5* beautiful hotel. A palace in every sense of the word. I was upgraded from a tower room to a palace room which was a bonus. Checkin was a dream with special Indian welcome ceremony. I have never seen so much granite in the bathroom. Sadly I was a solo traveller but i'm sure we could have fitted 10 people in the huge and ornate shower room!
Downside - although I got a very good room rate with Agoda drink and food charges in the hotel are astronomical - 500 rupees for a cup of tea or coffee! I also felt very guilty being in such luxury when millions live in the poverty and squallor of the Mumbai slums!
Incredible hotel, loved the stay. very close to great market too and amazing view of the gate....
This hotel is very peacefully, staff is very smilling (but not too much) and helpfull. Everything is perfect.I appreciate the swimmingpool, the gym, the restaurant and the kindness of the staff.

check in was very professional. security measured were a bit of a nuincance. room was spacious and clean, a bit damp though.
staff were pleasant and helpful. location was convenient but over-rated. breakfast was very good and refreshing. gym was excellent. foyer was beautiful and comfortable. will revisit.

Bet location for tourist as Gateway of India is just opposite the hotel with ferry to Elephanta Caves. Also, street shop along Colaba Causeway is 2 block away behind the hotel.Breakfast with great choice of variety of food including Indian, western, etc. Value for money as I have a good rate booked through Agoda.com. Definetely come back or recommend to friends whenever visiting Mumbai again. The only set back is that the carpet inside my room was aged and need to replace
and room house keeping need to upgrade as the keeper has not done a good job during my stay.

An ideal hotel to stay for tourist without budget limitation. A little expensive compare to US hotel with similar rating. Considering Mumbai hotel rate, its value for money for a 5* hotel. To maintain the high rating,the Management should considering changing the aged room carpet, improve house-keeping. Upkeep the high standard of restaurant service and quality of foods .Will stay in this hotel again and recommend to friends visiting Mumbai.

estancia fantastica, por su ubicacion, amabilidad del personal, instalaciones.

Hotel muy bien ubicado, muy centrico. La habitacion muy amplia y bonita, la cama muy comoda.
Gran variedad en el desayuno

Nuestra estancia fue muy buena, absoluto confort, lo √∫nico q nos extra√±o q en semejante hotel cobren el servicio de internet aparte, lo que tendr√≠a q estar incluido. Fuera de eso el hotel es lujoso y el servicio excelente , volver√≠amos a alojarnos all√≠ nuevamente sin duda, la piscina y el spa tambi√©n nos gust√≥ mucho y lo aprovechamos bien

Estancia muy agradable en un Hotel de lujo, situado junto a la puerta de la India ( Gateway of India ) y muy cerca de Marine Drive, tambi√©n conocida como el Collar de la Reina.Bonito paseo hacia Kala Ghoda, donde se pueden visitar la Rajabai Clock Tower, la High Court, la David Sassoon Library, el Elphinstone College asi como el museo Principe de Gales.Excelente servicio y con gran amabilidad. bien
Magnifique nous y retournons pour 1nuit le 9 janvier tant nous aimons cet h√¥tel
Enchante par l accueil et le service en general. Petit dejeuner buffet grandiose. Superbe piscine. Une chambre confortable et bien meuble avec vue sur la baie. Tout etait parfait!

c'est une belle immersion ds le temps, l'histoire et l'espace. la tout 'est que luxe, calme et seenite...

PLEASE I need an invoice for this stay, hotel did not supply to me, they said you will send me one; please do it ASAp on marion_mg@yahoo.fr ; thks!!
Nous avions r√©serv√© une chambre (la moins ch√®re) dans la tour mais nous avons eu la chance d'√™tre surclass√©s dans une chambre du palace.

C‚Äôest un h√¥tel (5 √©toiles) bien situ√© et proche des  commerces. Le hall d‚Äôentr√©e est vaste, aux d√©corations bien soign√©es. Le petit d√©jeuner est tr√®s copieux. L‚Äôh√¥tel m√©rite 5 √©toiles +.

c'est un bel hotel. a la hauteur de sa reputation pour ceux qui aiment les hotels de luxe.
quand je suis arrive j'etais malade. bien nous etions dimanche j'ai un appel d'un medecin qui a fait une consultation telephonique. tres bon service sincerement

Nous somme arriv√©s tr√®s t√¥t au Taj Mahal Palace (4 heure du ma), nous n'avons pu avoir notre chambre de suite, nous avons pu la r√©cup√©rer √† 8h30, et heureuse surprise, nous avons √©t√© surclass√©s dans la partie ancienne du palace. Personnel adorable,chambre classieuse, piscine agr√©able, buffet petit d√©jeuner √©norme... Un sans faute.

un havre de paix dans la folie de Mumbai, 
j ai adore les restaurants et l h√¥tel as un tr√®s bon service. 
j ai ete l√©g√®rement d√©√ßue par le spa.

Avons passe une seule nuit au Taj Mahal et avons eu la chance d etre surclasses dans le palace en luxury room avec vue sur la mer . Tout etait parfait , le personnel est particulierememt attentif , la chambre magnifique , et l emplacememt est stategique . Un momemt vraimemt magique.
eines der sch√∂nsten und besten hotels der welt

Ideal um zu Fu√ü S√ºdmumbai zu erkunden, Museen, Shopping, Restaurants.
Besonders zu empfehlen "Chen,s Beautyparlour, 5 min.entfernt!

Wir hatten von einem superior room im Taj mehr erwartet, liebloses Interieur mit kahler Wand (mit Ausnahme eines Flachbildfernsehers), leicht muffeliges Badezimmer mit  biederen schon leicht besch√§digten Kacheln und einer Badewanne mit Syntetikduschvorhang, naja, irgendwie nichtso richtig 5 Sterne...
Ansonsten ist die Lage unschlagbar und das gesamte Personal allesamt einfach unschlagbar freundlich.

F√ºr den Preis sind die Zimmer ( deluxe upper floor ) Mir durchschnittlich. In der Dusche fiel der Wasserknopf ab, die Klinke der Balkont√ºr lag im Schrank und das Internet funktionierte nur mit Unterbrechung.
Die Angestellten des Hotels sind so einem Haus entsprechend freundlich und zuvorkommend .
Das Taj Mahal Palace hat sich als die Topadresse in Mumbai bewiesen. Von Ankunft bis Abreise alles tiptop!
das sch√∂nste Hotel in Mumbai, wunderbare Atmosph√§re, eine Oase der Ruhe und Entspannung in der Megacity.

Das Hotel schlechthin in Indien. Sein Ruf eilt Ihm nicht voraus, alles, was man von diesem Hotel erwartet, wird mehr als erf√ºllt: Tolle Zimmer, extrem freundliches und zuvorkommendes Personal, hervorragendes Fr√ºhst√ºck.

Das Hotel ist seine 5 Sterne nicht wert. Der Service ist gut, aber nach 1 oder 2 Tagen kennt man das Buffet, es ist nicht Spitzenklasse. Die Zimmer sind sauber und der Service funktioniert, doch das Badezimmer war alt und entspricht nicht dieser Kategorie.
