**Feedback for Sahara Star Mumbai Hotel**

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Sahara Star, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience. Here are a few highlights:

**1. Exceptional Service:**  
From the moment I arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive. The check-in process was smooth, and the concierge team was helpful in arranging my activities.

**2. Stunning Ambiance:**  
The hotel has a unique design that beautifully blends luxury and nature. The indoor lagoon and tropical landscaping create a serene atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for relaxation.

**3. Immaculate Rooms:**  
My room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and impeccably clean. The amenities provided were top-notch, making my stay even more comfortable.

**4. Delicious Dining Options:**  
The variety of restaurants offered a wide range of cuisines. I particularly enjoyed dining at [specific restaurant name], where the dishes were not only tasty but presented beautifully.

**5. Excellent Location:**  
The hotel‚Äôs location is convenient, making it easy to access local attractions and the airport. This made my travel around Mumbai a breeze.

**6. Incredible Facilities:**  
The spa and fitness center were fantastic. I indulged in a relaxing massage that was just what I needed after a busy day.

Overall, my stay at Sahara Star was absolutely remarkable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and enjoyable experience in Mumbai. I can‚Äôt wait to  retrun

This is a popular hotel with some good dining options. Located very close to domestic airport terminal in Mumbai. In general rooms were clean and had all basic amenities. Staff needs to check that all plug points are working as we charge multiple devices these days. The hotel lobby also needs some more seating/ sprucing up.

I booked with agoda and had great experience, plus express checkin on mentioned time, great price for such a amazing property, staff was really nice and they upgraded us to great view room with minimum cost. Agoda is really recommend by me for budget traveling. I had great experience using this application. Overall great experience 5 star rating from my side.
It‚Äôs an iconic Mumbai luxury with a spectacular ambience. Great place to stay and enjoy‚Ä¶. Excellent restaurants, cuisines and service.

This hotel is located at a great place, so near to T1. I stayed for a day as I had to catch my connecting international flight. Room is good, nice and clean! I had to wait a bit for check-in and looks like there is no line policy which was different experience for me (this anyway has in India and people serving does not enforce it :( ). Any way's other than that all good..comfortable bed..great food..nice ambience..all good..would stay here again if come again to Mumbai.
Love this hotel
This hotel is amazing clean, modern and the staff is too good. Thumbs up to Novotel

Very clean and food was excellent.Staff were friendly.

Brand new hotel close to the airport , rooms very clean at Novotel standard , check-in out fast and smooth staff very friendly and professional all around . Only minus F&B  overpriced, paid 8000 over INR for a bottle of wine marked 1600 MRP , + tax + service ‚Ä¶ definitely overpriced .

Service was amazing in the hotel, very comfortable room, varied breakfast. Location was convenient as we had a very early flight however far from main attractions. The best was the people. A big shout out to Sneha and Rohit who made us feel so welcomed!

Took half an hour for me to check in as i cudnt get the key physical coz they use virtual key. Cudnt get double bed as they wanted to offer 2 single bed. Dint treat me like a 5 star guest at 5 start hotle
Clean hotel and good location

Our stay at Novotel Andheri Mumbai was average. While the location is convenient, and the rooms were clean, the service could have been more attentive. There were some delays in response times, and the dining options were just about satisfactory. It's a decent option for a short stay, but there's definitely room for improvement in overall guest experience.

My stay at Novotel Andheri Mumbai was average. While the location is convenient, and the rooms were clean, the service could have been more attentive. There were some delays in response times, and the staff at reception was too busy. It's a decent option for a short stay, but there's definitely room for improvement in overall guest experience.

Awesome stay

Hotel is nice. All staff were courteous including in cafe, front desk, and  restaurant.
I surely recommend breakfast at hotel. 

I enjoyed quiet stay and large room.

I and my husband had a stay in your hotel recently. On our way to your hotel I lost my mobile phone in a OLE car. I was there for a business meeting and had every details in my mobile of my clients. From you entrance security guards to your reception staff everyone was very helpful in every way. You really have the best team.¬†

Ms Sugandh and another staff from the reception i didn't get her name was very comforting and handle the situation so well and she recommended us to Mr Bhushan and was keep telling us he will try to help us find the phone.

Mr Bhushan went very far to find our mobile phone and made things so easy for us and he was well knowledge men and helpful men. We being not local and a tourist and not knowing anyone in the city it was very helpful of Bhushan and he and your team surely deserve the best appreciation.¬†

I was so stressed and went to your 2nd¬†floor restaurant to have some food to make myself feel better. I meet this waiter I didn't get his name he made me feel so better by talking to me and telling me I will get the handphone back don't worry. And he recommended the best chicken biryani which i have never ate before in my life it was the best. As for the breakfast 2 guys were so helpful too and your restaurant does a good job by giving us good food and a big spread.
Rooms and towels were very clean, the staff was very friendly at breakfast and dinner.  We were traveling with 2 kids and the hotel was quite nice.
Very Polite staff well organised everythings gud hygiene
Hotel room was big and clean. Bed was big and comfortable. Breakfast had a good spread.

They gave me a room on the 10th floor and the 11th floor had party everyday and it was so noisy, when I called in, they said it will stop by 11.30pm and I'm able to sleep after that. Having visiting mumbai for business, I turn in to bed by 10pm so that I can start my day early. But suffered for 3nights there. Communicated it with the staff but all they had was just apologies and no solution. Party ends at 11.30pm. But then the cleaning starts upto 2/3am. Ridiculous how they manage all this.
I had paid for three person in advance but they put towel and other things like toothbrush water bottles for only two person that is only problem otherwise it‚Äôs very good stay

Below par
My stay was very nice. Best place to visit in mumbai for stay and the hotel staff is so helpful and friendly They provide us a best service thank you . Happy to visit again.

Two day visit early June. Good points: excellent staff and service,  clean and nice room. Restaurant is good, the food variety is good though not enormous, probably more veg options than nonveg. 

To improve: small niggles in the room: bed not precisely alligned, bathroom door difficult to lock, safe having software error, toilet shower having too much pressure, flush water leaking a little.
Overall a good experience!!

Room is spacious.
But overall lot of improvements can be done.
Reception staff was not well versed with the checkin process. Initially they have given me in too floor, then due to room door lock issue changed to another floor.
In that room as usual TV was having issue - but the operator came and did the repair and made okay, they were good in work. Toilet also wash area water was not flowing fast, somewhere some block was there.

Bed was cozy, so sleep was good.

I stayed on 1st April. The hotel is sparklingly clean and the staffs are super kind.
One glitch was in the food which was managed extremely well by the staffs.

Second stay was from 13th to 17th April.
Again, everything was smooth. But I believe there is a lack of communication between staffs. You need to fix that. I was supposed to get 20% on food and beverages but nothing like that was given even after said that we are allocated the 20% on every food we order from the restaurant. Neither a reimbursement was made. 
And again, there was a major glitch in the food which I don't want to mention.

A 5 star hotel cannot do such mistakes. It's horrible as we are paying a huge sum of money to stay there.

One thing was good that the restaurant in charge as well as the chef came personally to the room to apologize and they provided some desserts which we didn't take as we were not craving for free things but to get the high standards we paid for specially for the food.

Overall, the stay was excellent. I loved the cleanliness.
Some people have commented that they see slums nearby and people just keep staring at them. I will deny this. To me, seeing those slums (small houses) made me feel more humble. We are all humans. Having some compassion in the heart is always good for every kind of people.

I will definitely stay in the hotel next time provided the restaurant staff make sure they don't repeat such a horrible mistake 3rd time with us.

During my recent one-night stay at The LaLiT Mumbai, I was thoroughly impressed by the hotel's grandeur and hospitality. The moment I entered, the expansive lobby captivated me with its elegant design and ambient lighting, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The staff were exceptionally courteous, ensuring a smooth check-in process and offering assistance throughout my stay.
The hotel's facilities are top-notch... Additionally, the outdoor swimming pool offered a serene environment to relax and enjoy the pleasant Mumbai weather. The highlight of my stay was the breakfast buffet at the 24/7 Restaurant. The spread was extensive, featuring a delightful mix of Indian and international cuisines. From freshly prepared dosas and sambhar to a variety of pastries and cold cuts, every item was flavorful and well-presented. The attentive service by the restaurant staff enhanced the dining experience, making it truly memorable. Overall, The LaLiT Mumbai offers a luxurious and comfortable stay with exceptional service and amenities. I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a premium hotel experience in Mumbai.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at your esteemed hotel for a day, and I must say, it was a delightful experience from start to finish. Your staff's exceptional service and attention to detail truly made my stay memorable.

From the warm welcome at check-in to the seamless check-out process, every interaction with your team was courteous and professional. The room was immaculate and comfortable, providing the perfect sanctuary after a long day of travel.

I would highly recommend Lalit Hotel Mumbai to anyone seeking a luxurious and hospitable stay in the city. Your commitment to excellence is evident in every aspect of the guest experience, and I look forward to returning in the future.

Thank you once again for a fantastic stay.

Warm regards,

Hari kohli

The reception area was beautiful. Room was spacious and clean. Would have been exceptional if the attached balcony would be accessible but I guess they keep it locked. Buffer breakfast was good and lots of variety. Overall a wonderful experience.

We have stayed many times in this prepert since 2011 and found it best always in terms of facilities, cleanliness and staff. The best part of staying here is the breakfast which has spread which is luscious and palatable. Great stay always highly recommended place to stay in Mumbai

We stayed in lalit hotel for 3 nights it was amazing everything very comfortable and quiet room all things neat and clean in the room and high security at entrance every time they checked everything all staff reaspectfully and helpfull we recommended to everyone visit to this hotel

The Retreat is a perfect staycation with family and friends. It has all the facilities one could ever want, for children and adults alike. The play area is fun along with many indoor games like table tennis, billiards, carom, foosball, air hockey etc. You can also indulge in some self- care with steam bath, spa, Jacuzzi to name a few. There is close access to the beach or can simple choose to sit on the property among trees, plenty of flower gardens and a widespread of green grass. As evening dawns you can enjoy a relaxing time at the pool side loungers and gaze at the stars. You will never get bored here. The rooms are clean, service is up to the mark, staff is friendly‚Ä¶ what more could one ask for? The food is excellent with a wide cuisine, prices are a little high, but worth it once in a while. The Retreat is an all in one perfect package for an amazing getaway.

Stay and booking prize through Agoda is good and value for money.  The facility and the staff are also very good and friendly. Good clean pool and well maintained garden and lawn. Overall the place is very good for the experience in the price. 

But my only complain is that the food is way overpriced. Its like they are trying to coverup for the discount we got for the room in their food.  I tried the buffet dinner and it cost upto appox 1650per person with tax. With that amout i would expect a huge variety and options but sadly they provided any one starter for non veg thats it. And that too the quality, varity and taste wasn‚Äôt anything exceptional. So it was a big let down on the cost of food prizes. To top it off one cup of tea cost 235 rs. 

So overall if you are okay with the food prices then its worth visiting.  But if you like me who is choosing this place cause your getting a good deal on the room then please make arrangements to eat else where or else you will end up paying the same amout for food as you did for the room.

The place is well maintained and the staff is super polite. The rooms are spacious and super comfortable. The bathrooms are good too and the bathtub was the highlight of the stay.

There are some issues for sure. The place is far and road sucks. The thing that miffed me the most was the charge for plates and cutlery. We every charged 150 bucks for a set of plates and cutlery, this is a rather underhanded way of restricting customers from getting their own food.

Overall the stay was quite good with amazing food, humble staff & location is good but uncomfortable to travel due to under-construction roads & chaotic traffic. I think the local government should look into this matter. 
Rooms are cozy & attractive amazing ambience with the washroom & wardrobe section which falls completely seperate from the bed area. 
POV: the breakfast should have been included with the stay package.
Washrooms flush was a bit annoying as it has to be continuously pressed for the water flow.

Amazing property with access to beach. Inground swimming pool with changing rooms and f&b services. Dedicated area for DJs and parties. 
Has humongous dining halls with different dinner themes. We enjoyed the candle night dinner. Got the chance to meet their chef saab and he customized dinner options for us. 
The room was clean and housekeeping made it looked well done on both days. 
Food - 10/10
Room - 9/10
Services - 10/10
you will never get disappointed at the service

I booked this as a treat of for 2 of my friends and they had the worst experience ever! 
We were unpleasantly surprised and disappointed at the standard of the room & services , especially at a hotel like the Taj, which has a stellar reputation of unparalleled luxury! My guests room in the Tower section of the hotel had bedbugs! My friends who went back to a family member‚Äôs home in Bombay was getting her clothes washed when the maid noticed the bugs! They had to get everything in her luggage and the whole house, including the curtains, bedspreads & cushioning boiled, steamed and then laundered! Though age had spotted bugs along the paneling on the walls, she didn‚Äôt want to create a big deal till she got home and Mainly because she  didn‚Äôt think that they would have got into her luggage! To top everything everything off they can‚Äôt even make a decent milkshake by the poolside! Even after informing them  that they haven‚Äôt stirred it well and that the cocoa is all stuck to the bottom and that it all you get through the straw is cocoa, they didn‚Äôt attempt to redo it or to offer us another one and they made it exactly the same way the next day as well! I‚Äôm appalled that though we have informed them, nobody has gotten back to us!

The service is the first thing I want to write about. Absolutely impeccable! From reception to housekeeping and breakfast staff, everyone cared incredibly to make sure we had a positive stay. The room was beautifully designed with a high ceiling and nice decorations. Stay here for  a fabulous experience in Mumbai. Walking distance to good restaurants and super close to Colaba Causeway for some shopping.

We can't wait to visit again.

Best hotel experience I have had so far. We were upgraded to a club room for a small price, which was fabulous. The building is beautiful and the staff and service beyond excellent. Would go back any time!
It is just amazing. It worth to stay here just for a day (as it is expensive) to have a taste of luxury.

I have enjoyed staying at this hotel in all respects whether in the service, reception, treatment, eating or cleaning  rooms, but the price of the rooms is very high and I recommend it to the owners of high budgets but the owners of low budgets do not recommend it because there are luxury hotels and cheaper than that...

Taj Mahal is the best one in the area and My favourite for relaxation they have the best spa ever

Well worth the experience. The hotel has a rich history and amazing architecture that has last the years. Service was top notch and staff were really attentive. Nothing to fault! There were different wings to the hotel and some parts were undergoing refurbishment with minimal disruption to guests. Our room faced the Gateway of India too hence we got to see the traffic and experience the bustle from our balcony. Food at the restaurants were great thus one didn't need to head out to try the various cuisines if you chose to. Loved the experience and stay. A recommend!
I was very impressed with Taj. Staffs were nice. Hopefully I will return again and recommend to my friends.

Superb, couldn't do enough for you. Friendly helpful top quality

Upgraded to Club level.  Staff very accommodating and went out of their  way to anticipate any needs we might have had. Also  we were informed of special programs offered at hotel.   Breakfast is extensive and delicious

The Taj Mahal Palace is an impressive Grand Hotel, how you imagine it should be. Location, service, view, stuff - whatever you are talking about.
Only disadvantage are the prices in the restaurants - they are also grand. Especially if you compare it to the price level around. But overall a must in Mumbai.

The hotel was superb. Attention to detail was 100% and the staff were delightful. The buffet breakfast had something for every taste in the huge choice on offer. Pool area was very pretty. very good hotel
Lovely old turn of the century hotel meticulously maintained and upgraded.  Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.  Great service.  Would stay here again.

The gem of Mumbai, an extraordinary hotel, incredible location, wonderful swimming pool, delightful staff, delicious breakfast buffet, amazing rooms... I am a repeat visitor and will never consider staying anywhere else when in Mumbai.

Excellent location, Knowledgable and courteous staff.

very good

The hotel is steeped in history and magnificent, the location is brilliant, however the prices are exorbitant and the room was not cleaned properly from the last occupant.....there was toe nails on the floor.
Your staff were beyond excellent.

From the moment you arrive there are warm welcomes and many unexpected extras. We were upgraded to the magnificent heritage palace wing and everything was catered for, even before you realised you needed something, it was there. Yes you do pay more for everything, but the service, surrounds and attention to detail are worth it for a special treat. definitely will go back

If you want to experience something very special than visit this place. History goes along with an outstanding service and beautiful views. Take a room in the old part of the hotel which is more expensive but so much more unforgetable. If you have a chance get a room with view of the ocean and the gate of India. A great experience will wait for you!
Friendly, professional, comfortable; an excellent hotel - we will visit again
Sumptuous rooms. The heritage tour was very interesting.

This is a magnificent establishment, and I'm pleased my group decided to stay here for a night after having spent 2 weeks trekking through the Himalaya sleeping in tents! We were a bit embarrassed arriving with backpacks etc, but the staff were wonderful and we even received upgrades. My only disappointment was our stay was too short!

The Taj Palace hotel is one of my best hotel experiences thus far.  From the moment I arrived I was made to feel special by the hotel staff.  My stay was during Diwali 2016 and the hotel as adorned is Diwali ornaments and decorations.  At the reception desk, Priyanka greeted me with a smile and was extremely helpful.  I had an early check-in and she upgraded my room.  Thanks Priyanka.  My room came with butler service and provided fresh fruits which I requested.  The rooms are spacious and well designed.    A staff member escorted me to my room and made sure all was just right.  The property is gorgeous and not far from many attractions and sightseeing i.e. India‚Äôs Gateway.   Overall, great staff, rooms, service, and location.  I really enjoyed my stay at the Taj Palace Hotel and look forward to my next stay when I‚Äôm back in Mumbai.
Would recommend to anyone wanting an unforgettable  experience
Loved my stay here.  Absolutely A+.  Staff was fantastic, hotel was amazing, everything about my stay was great and I don't say that lightly.

All staff were just so welcoming and polite.
Hotel is impeccably clean. Lots of fine furniture, display items around and the location is great.
Pool area was lovely. Choice of eateries.
5 star.
It was so beautiful stay & wish we could stay longer.

Our superior king city view room was in the palace wing of the Taj. The charm of the palace wing is unmatchable. The team did up our room with lovely decor & filled with balloons since its our wedding anniversary. We even celebrated with a small size chocolate cake, compliments from the hotel. 

My wife had a pleasant surprise when the room attendant Keton & housekeeper Saksham left a pouch of indian accessories on the desk. She was delighted as its in time for our dinner at Souk. It matches her outfit too!

In particular, we enjoyed having breakfast at Shamiana instead of the Sea Lounge as Magalhaes was always there to brighten our mornings.  His service is commendable!

Taj is definately an experience you will remember and we are looking forward to coming back. Oh I almost forgot...u must join the daily tour of the hotel. Don't miss it.

Nothing here is a problem for management or staff. All performed beyond expectations and nothing was to much trouble. We received a most unexpected upgrade to a suite and when asked why, "because we can" was their response. The food and wine was varied and fairly priced. We ate at the Indian restaurant which was fantastic, excellent service. Breakfast buffet was outstanding.  Nothing was out of place and if you intend going to Udaipur this is a must. Beautiful. We will return and recommend it highly.
Very beautiful and the best location. The starbuck coffee just in the same building
Very comfortable rooms and very delecious food
enjoyed my stay
Service

Excellent facilities with high level of Staff hospitality

From the time l checked in, when l was offered an upgrade wt a sea-view, until l checked out, l was treated like royalty. Every staff member l encountered went 'above & beyond' to assure that my time there was happy.

Breakfast was sumptuous & service superb.
Every corner of the hotel exudes charm & grace.
The Taj is not somewhere to sleep, it's an experience.

We really enjoyed our stay last weekend. Kids enjoyed it the most. Not a complaint but more of a feedback is that pool could be little more kids friendly (depth was a bit high). A game room or recreation room would have been great as well.

Loved it regardless!!!
Excellent in all aspects!
Perfect

Location of the hotel is just too beautiful and coupled with the impeccable service offered by the staff is just too good. Keep it up and I recommend to each one visiting Mumbai..shd stay at Taj Mahal Palace and experience the grand ambiance and early sunrise from the hotel room.
The absolute best service I've ever had by the most respectful and pleasant staff. And the marble bathrooms are terrific.
the rooms were not as great as expected. however, the service more than made up for it. the Sea Lounge served an excellent high-tea. The breakfast was high quality. overall, a great experience.
A wonderful experience in a Mumbai institution.  The staff really looked after us during our stay.

I have travelled a lot and always stayed in a variety of Hotels but there is none to beat Taj Mahal Palace  Hotel in Gateway Mumbai. From the time you enter to the time you leave everything is so perfect be it friendly staff to cleanliness. Please always stay this way!

The hotel is beautiful. Lots of heritage and character but modern finishes and comfort. We loved the pool, breakfast, all the restaurants were good and the location was perfect as a first time tourist in Mumbai. 

The staff were all very friendly and nothing was a problem.
Palace service was superbly excellent. I've stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and Taj still managed to pleasantly impress. I will definitely come back again!
Good location
Overall a great hotel.
Highly recommended

if you go to Mumbai it has to be this hotel
Fantastic

The Taj Mahal Palace is obviously THE place to stay in Mumbai but it lets itself down on a couple of minor points that shouldn't happen in a top class hotel.
The extras details in the bathroom were a bit basic and the safe was too small to take a small size laptop. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Lovely gardens and pool. Superb location.
Excellent night

Our stay at the Taj was absolutely superb.  The staff are very polite,  friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good with a variety of food. The room was clean and very nice. We enjoyed our 2 nights at The Taj and look forward to staying there soon.
The only negative was the bad quality of wine and drinks. The internet was also very slow and we lost the connection all the time. The breakfast in the Sea Lounge was excellent!

Fantastic

Everything about our stay at the Taj Mahal Palace was superb. However, we were disappointed by the description of the view from the bedroom window!

We  booked a "Deluxe Harbour View" room but the only way we could actually see the 'harbour' was to put our faces up against the window and look to the right, at which point we were able to see a corner of it. Standing 'in' the centre of the room, the view was of a wall of the new Taj Mahal wall which stands in front of the 'old'. Had I known this was to be the case, I would have booked a different room.

Whoever wrote the view description had a very inventive mind!
Hotel most accommodating for our early arrival and a late departure. Take the free daily tour of the hotel to learn about the building and some history. Staff very helpful.

We had requested a non-smoking room in the tower. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a suite in the Palace, however, we were not informed that it was a smoking suite. Not good if you have asthma. Other than that, we were satisfied.
From booking in through to leaving all staff seemed exceptionally well organised, friendly and eager to please.   The stay at this hotel was a delightful and memorable experience.
We had the most amazing time the staff were excellent and location was perfect for our first time to Mumbai we plan to revisit I'm October.

The hotel is fantastic in every way. It's an impeccably well run hospitality oasis close to most major attractions in Mumbai, and great shopping.

The staff is professional, prompt and highly discreet. The food is excellent, as is room service. The gym, spa and hotel pool are well maintained - in particular the pool is an experience of its own.

I can't say enough about this hotel. As someone who travels about 150 days a year all over the world I can say with confidence that this is one of the very best hotels in the world.

will stay in this hotel all of my future stay.

Rest of the experience is wonderful as you can expect it in this hotel....Will visit again but hopefully we'll have no troubles like this time....
Excellent hotel.

Beautiful, couldn't have stayed at a better hotel to round off my 30 days overseas. Staff were very competent and extremely polite and friendly. We had a wonderful stay beginning with a very personal and efficient check in process, and continuing with superb service all through our time at the Taj. The ambiance of this hotel is truly unique. I stayed in the old wing which was superb however a friend that I was traveling with was in the new wing and experienced multiple problems in the room such as AC, Windows, noise of construction etc.  staff service is generally of a very high standard however it is variable and inconsistent particularly around the pool area.

The rooms within the Palace were just a delight to be in as was the constant attention to detail from the turn down service to the beautiful rose petal designs left in the room after cleaning.  Its obvious that all the staff love working there and it really is an Indian Institution that all should sample.  We can not recommend this hotel enough.

Wonderful, superb, They came to know that its our marriage anniversary and we were amazed by the gifts , cake, champagne, flowers. Not only this my kid was taken care also.. Dance class for him, then drawing book for him so that he enjoys his stay.

wonderful front desk ladies who were prompt, joyful, respecting, attentive, vibrant and happy to help. My family got overwhelmed by the service .

Great stay for those who want to be treated like royalty. Everything was great. My only reservation was that they were too attentive, we were asked if we needed anything about 10 times in a day. A little tiresome, but everything was great when we actually did need help with packing a parcel. They provided everything we needed. I have been visiting india and particularly Mumbai for most of my years, generally on an annual basis and especially in the last 8 years each time visiting another city and returning to mumbai.
I have stayed in hostels in dongri, in bhendi bazaar and new bombai. Each time experiencing something new, but I know that now I will find it really difficult to stay anywhere else.

It's my third time in Taj Mahal Palace , and I got the chance to stay in the palace section this time with my wife , she really enjoyed her stay and asked me to take her back to it again. Mumbai is one of the cities that I really love and can't get enough of. The Staff is friendly and the breakfast is good. Taj Mahal Palace will be always my first choice whenever I am in Mumbai
A step back in time. One of the world's classic hotels.
Fabuloud

I cannot rate this hotel high enough. From a luxury point of view, it is amazing and the hotel is beautiful. But the service was just incredible and is what sets it above others. We arrived about 5.30am and we told we could pay a half board to have the room ready by 7am. This gave us time to have breakfast in quiet surroundings with a personal butler. To continue the great service we were upgraded to the Palace side which I would recommend paying more to stay in anyway. Each night we came back to our room to find personal gifts such as cake, silk scarves, Indian jewellery and one night 2 foot bathes were set up for my husband and I - the water was promptly delivered for us. Just what we needed after walking a lot in the heat. Relaxing in the pool each afternoon was also wonderful, and again the service by the pool staff was fantastic. Compared to other countries, the prices for accommodation and breakfast was very reasonable and so worth it.
In Mumbai, I would say go to Leopolds for beer and cheap curry, good fun and great taste. To upgrade a little, there is a local restaurant not far called Khyber - best Indian food we have ever had. 
With the help of a Dharavi local based tour company, Mystical Mumbai, we had an eye opening tour of the slum which we recommend. Make sure you check the taxi meters are on and you can rent a taxi for about 350 rupees an hour. Colabar Causeway is excellent for bartering for anything and the local shops along here, although generally fixed price, are still very cheap for well made Indian cotton clothing.
The stay at the Taj was a sheer delight. The staff where so attentive and made you feel very special. My stay was perfect.
Good
Very excellent

Extraordinary. Exceeded what were already very high expectations based on last time. Faultess. Staff go out of their way and over and above every time. Truly one of the best hotel stays anywhere on this planet.
We asked the reception for connecting room . They told your requested under process until the last no body update us

It's one of the best hotels not only in India but the world!!

Everything about the Taj Mahal Palace hotel is delightful - the architecture, the service quality, the spa, the people, the food!!
Excellent hotel the service is good i will recommend this hotel they hv nice rooms

We were given a sea view room which made our trip that extra special. The breakfast was quite a variety and delicious, looking forward to the next trip.
Excellent

Service was beyond compare and whilst expensive to stay represented superb value for money.
The ambience through the entire hotel was amazing.

We ate twice at the Masala Kraft restaurant and the food was simply fantastic, the Sketch menu was outstanding value as it was cooked fresh in front of you at your table and the Chef explained everything to do with the meal.

It is hard to put in to words how wonderful the staff were. From the front desk and check in to the house staff to the management...everyone was dedicated to ensuring a wonderful stay.

The Palace wing is steeped in atmosphere and ambience and was amazing.

As we were in the Taj Club section and were very lucky in that the hotel upgraded us to a suite we also had the high tea element, free cocktails, free cognac & chocolates and free tea and coffee throughout the stay in the Palace Lounge. A free transfer from the airport to the Taj was included as was breakfast.

The stay was not just a highlight of the trip but to be honest a lifetime highlight as well!

We simply can't recommend the Taj Palace enough, it is a truly magical hotel providing a truly magical stay.
We had a fabulous time and look forward to our next visit, unfortunately next year
